Name: 1646 Experimental Art Space
Description_Text:
Step into 1646, where contemporary art becomes an experience! Here, the museum invites you to see the world through fresh eyes, reminding you that art—like life—is about more than just understanding. It's about experiencing, feeling, and embracing surprises that inspire.

Perspectief
At 1646, we are proud to present exciting solo shows that feature new work by both emerging and established artists created specifically for these exhibitions. Our dynamic program is filled with engaging artist talks, unique events, and insightful publications, along with a dedicated artist residency that nurtures creativity at its core.
Join us at 1646, immerse yourself in new artistic worlds and discover what art can mean for you—come, feel, and be inspired!

Name: ABC Architectuurcentrum Haarlem
Description_Text:
ABC Haarlem is the center for architecture and urban planning in Haarlem and the Kennemerland region. ABC offers activities centered on interior design, architecture, urban planning and landscape.

Built-up area
The ABC Architecture Center is of interest to anyone who is professionally occupied with the built-up area: architects, urban planners, landscape architects, project developers and policymakers, as well as the general public, young people and educational institutions.

Name: ARTIS-Groote Museum
Description_Text:
The Main Building (het Groote Museum) is the first and most impressive ARTIS building. It is on the first plot of land ever owned by ARTIS: the buiten-Middenhof. This land was bought by ARTIS founders Westerman, Werlemann and Wijsmuller, known as the 3 Ws, in 1838.

The Groote Museum takes you on a personal expedition, with your body as the starting point. It’s like staring into a mirror and discovering more and more. Like similarities to plants, other animals and even microbes. You then start to see cross-connections. Your intestines are not so different from the roots of a tree, for example. And when you were crawling as an infant, you moved just like a crocodile. Recognizing these similarities makes you see yourself and the world around you in a different light. You realize how intertwined you are with all living things, down to the smallest fiber of your being. And that you are much less independent than you thought.

Name: ARTIS-Micropia
Description_Text:
Micropia showcases the most powerful, successful and smallest life form on earth: microorganisms. Every human being is carrying around 1.5 kilograms of them, in and on their bodies. See yourself and the world from a different perspective after visiting Micropia.

Is there life up your nose? What is a fungus, exactly? And what’s living inside your digestive tract?

Microorganisms are everywhere and are crucial to life on planet Earth. You can watch living microbes eat, move and reproduce with 3D-viewers specially developed for Micropia. Find your way in the habitat of extremophiles – Microbes that manage to survive in extreme environments. Learn more about your microorganisms using the body scan.

Just as last year, measures have been put in place to make your visit to Micropia as safe as possible. Visitors are required to pre-order their tickets and indicate their arrival time on the website. To avoid crowding, the number of guests allowed in the museum at one time is limited.

Suitable for ages eight and older
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Agrarisch Museum Westerhem
Description_Text:
Due to COVID-19, Agrarisch Museum Westerhem is closed until further notice. Activities have either been cancelled or postponed due to COVID-19. This follows national policy and the recommendations of the National Institute for Public Health and the Environment (RIVM).

Stolpboerderij
Agrarisch Museum Westerhem is housed in a renovated stolpboerderij (a square farmhouse typical of the province of North Holland) dating from 1877. It became a museum in 2000. The living room with a closet-bed for the employee is quite unique. The farmhouse is typical of the regional style with a pyramid shape and the stable and living room are around the haystack creating a square. The cowshed consists of summer stable, cheese production and winter stable, with the horse stable adjacent to it. The hay loft is above. In the barnhouse you can see how people lived and worked in approximately 1900.

Name: Airborne Museum at Hartenstein
Description_Text:
The Airborne Museum is located in the beautifully restored Villa Hartenstein. Hartenstein served as headquarters for British airborne troops in September 1944.  Experience the Battle of Arnhem like never before.

New
The stories told in the museum revolve around Villa Hartenstein. Hartenstein symbolizes the huge transition the area underwent during the Second World War. In the 19th century, the lovely area around Oosterbeek attracted many rich merchants from the west, who built their country homes here. Hartenstein is one of these country homes and represents the idyll of prewar times.

Battle of Arnhem
During the Battle of Arnhem in September 1944, part of Operation Market Garden, Hartenstein became the headquarters for British airborne troops. The Allied forces failed in their valiant attempt to force their way into the Ruhr and swiftly end the Second World War. The bridge at Arnhem turned out to be A Bridge Too Far . Hartenstein now brings to life the personal stories of British, Polish and German soldiers and civilians, through unique items from the museum’s collection.

Experience the battle in all its intensity at the underground Airborne Experience and become part of the 9-day operation.

Name: Allard Pierson
Description_Text:
The Allard Pierson Museum shares the collections of the University of Amsterdam with visitors and scholars. The collections range from Egyptian antiquities and medieval manuscripts to atlases by Joan Blaeu and modern graphic design.

From animal mummies to Roman glass

The permanent exhibition features a lot, From the animal mummies of Ancient Egypt and the decorated pottery of Greece to fragile Roman glass and textiles preserved by the desert sand. You can start your journey of discovery in the gallery on the origins of script, or in the Egyptian cabinet, with its stories about temples and gods. It’s easy to wander for hours in the galleries on the Greek and Roman worlds. Marvel at the reconstruction of an Etruscan tomb in Italy, full of pottery vessels.

Cast gallery

The Allard Pierson owns nearly 300 casts of sculptures from antiquity, mainly copies from the Greek classical and Hellenistic periods. These sculptures offer insight into how eras and cultures influenced each other.

Cabinet of Stories

Every few months, a special object from the collection takes center stage. The curator writes a blog about it and talks to an expert in a video. See the object for yourself in one of the museum's most beautiful rooms. What can an object from the past tell us today?

Geozone

View reproductions of approximately one thousand historical maps in the GeoZone, part of the museum's cartographic collection

Studio

Do you like listening to music? Find out more about the Allard Pierson's audio collections in this space. Analogue sound recordings such as tapes and cassettes are digitised here

Name: Amsterdam Museum aan de Amstel
Description_Text:
Admire 30 huge group portraits from the 17th century, all part of the collections of the Amsterdam Museum and Rijksmuseum. The ‘brothers and sisters’ of The Night Watch are unique and rarely exhibited due to their size. Admire them in the Hermitage Amsterdam.

Success
The paintings show regents, civic guards and merchants from all strata of society. They are linked by their success, some of them being the most influential and wealthy residents of 17th-century Holland. They all had enough money to commission the best artists to paint their militia company.

Collaboration
In early 2014, the directors of the Amsterdam Museum, Hermitage Amsterdam and Rijksmuseum ratified their partnership for a permanent exhibition of over 30 enormous 17th-century group portraits. This was the first time a collection of group portraits of this size would be exhibited together.

Name: Amsterdam Pipe Museum
Description_Text:
Come see the world’s oldest known tobacco pipe, a ceremonial royal pipe from Cameroon and many examples of the “common man’s” pipe. At the Amsterdam Pipe Museum, discover the story of pipe smoking culture on five continents, from long ago until present times.

The Amsterdam Pipe Museum curates a collection that is unique to both the Netherlands and Europe. The museum presents an overview of smoking culture on five continents from 500 BCE to the present. To view the collection online: click this link.

African Chief pipe
The collection, which was started through a private initiative some 50 years ago, showcases pipes from all over the world: from Mexico to Japan and from Lapland to South Africa. Admire the earliest known pipe in the world, unearthed in Ecuador and which was made 2,500 years ago. Marvel at the design of European pipes and the unique art form their carving represents. A ceremonial royal pipe from Cameroon, adorned with 27,500 colored glass beads, is one of the museum’s highlights. In the museum you will also find many examples of stummel pipes of the “common man”. A visit to the museum is a world tour of pipe-smoking culture from all eras of history.

Name: Anne Frank Huis
Description_Text:
Note : Visitors to the Anne Frank House must purchase an online ticket for a specific time slot.

During the Second World War, Anne Frank spent over two years hiding in a secret annex at Prinsengracht 263, Amsterdam. A visit to the place where she wrote her diary is an unforgettable experience.

People from all over the world come to Prinsengracht to visit the building where Anne Frank and her family spent two years in hiding during the Second World War. A unique part of this museum is the secret annex where Anne wrote her world-famous diary.

Anne’s story
The rooms are empty except for documents and the belongings of the eight people who hid there. The front part of the house tells the story of Anne Frank based on quotations from her diary, historical documents, photographs, audiovisual footage and original objects. Anne Frank’s original diaries and writings are displayed in another room.

Name: Anton Pieck Museum
Description_Text:
Anton Pieck himself helped design the courtyard, façade and interior of ‘his’ museum in Hattem.

Enter the fairy tale-world of Anton Pieck via the historic courtyard. This home-like museum houses his desk and exhibits a large number of his works. The museum includes the sketches Anton Pieck created for De Efteling, a fantasy-themed amusement park and the Netherlands’ biggest theme park. Temporary exhibitions and workshops ensure that there is always something new to be discovered.

Permanent exhibition
The permanent exhibition includes Anton Pieck’s original work corner. The permanent exhibition is transformed annually during the winter break, for which the curator selects a new set of works by Anton Pieck from the repository. Works reflecting the many talents of this wonderful artist are always included in the exhibition. The ground floor includes the etching press used by Anton Pieck to create etchings, engravings and drypoint works. The etching press is still used for the etching workshops.

Families
Two scavenger hunts have been set out in the museum, one for younger children and one for older ones. The latter can be done independently by the children or with the parents joining in the fun.

Designed by Pieck
Pieck himself helped design the courtyard, façade and interior of ‘his’ museum.

Name: BAK, basis voor actuele kunst
Description_Text:
BAK, basis voor actuele kunst (basis for contemporary art), is a podium for art, knowledge and activism. The museum poses the most pressing social, ideological and environment-related questions of the day.

Art as public domain
BAK combines public programming and exhibitions with research, education and talent development. The museum works with art, social activism and academic sciences. It brings together artists, theoreticians and other members of vulnerable classes. In doing so, BAK cultivates a public domain for aesthetic political experimentation.

Name: Bakkerijmuseum De Oude Bakkerij
Description_Text:
Bakery Museum De Oude Bakkerij (The old bakery) is the tastiest museum in the Netherlands! The bakery is steeped in an historic atmosphere and the smells of freshly baked goods. Children can take part in delicious activities.

Step inside and immediately travel back in time as you discover the historic shop, the bustling bakery and the demonstration rooms with many kinds of confections, ranging from chocolate and marzipan to ice cream. Discover how they are made and turned into delicacies or even edible art.

Delicious activities
Children can take part in delicious activities no surcharge or reservation required. Simply roll up your sleeves and help the baker. The bakery museum presents tasty knowledge on near-forgotten, historic bakery techniques. A feast of historic smells.

Name: Belasting & Douane Museum
Description_Text:
From bike taxes to bikes used for smuggling; the Tax & Customs Museum is a contemporary museum on societally relevant themes. The museum offers a historic and cultural experience for young and old alike through its collection, exhibitions and activities.

A tour of discovery
Go on a tour of discovery in the Tax & Customs Museum and let yourself be surprised. Special objects and stories offer you a thematic and interactive peek into our history of taxation. What kind of items were subject to excise duties and tolls in the past? When was the bike tax dropped?

Art
This theme inspired artists like Isaac Israëls, Jan van Goyen and Jurriaen Pool II. The installations of contemporary artists Caspar Berger and Rueben Margolin give this subject a modern twist.

A different point of view
Share your thoughts with the museum’s Luisterend Oor (listening ear) or relax underneath the Belastingplafond (tax ceiling) and watch the parade of tax provisions go by. See what tax money has been spent on over the centuries and witness the development of the Netherlands. In short, discover the world of taxation from the other side and share your thoughts with the listening ear.

Museum café and garden
After your visit, relax in the pleasant café or, if weather permits, the inner garden.
Facilities: Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Betje Wolff Museum
Description_Text:
Betje Wolff’s independent spirit is evident in her epistolary novels written in her study in the attic. The Betje Wolff museum focuses on her life and life in the Beemster.

Since 1950, the Betje Wolff Museum has been housed in the former clergy house at Middenweg 178 in Middenbeemster.
Betje (Elizabeth) Wolff-Bekker lived here from 1759 to 1777 alongside her husband, the minister Adrianus Wolff, to whom she was married out and who was thirty years her senior.

Period rooms in the Beemster
The museum is home to Wolff’s restored writing room; its bookcases are filled with books written by herself as well as Aagje Deken with whom she lived after being widowed. The house also contains several period rooms dating from different centuries, offering an impression of how people in the Beemster lived in the past.

The comprehensive collection comes courtesy of inhabitants of the Beemster, who wish to see the history of the area preserved.

Herb garden
Behind the house, there’s a beautiful orchard in 18th century style, with an herb and vegetable garden.

Name: Bevrijdingsmuseum Zeeland
Description_Text:
Bevrijdingsmuseum Zeeland (Liberation Museum Zeeland) illustrates the eventful history of Zeeland during the Second World War. The museum focuses in particular on the Battle of the Scheldt.

Learning from the past for a peaceful future
Liberation Museum Zeeland illustrates the eventful history of Zeeland during the Second World War. The core of this story is the Battle of the Scheldt. In the autumn of 1944, Allied and German forces fought bitterly for control of the Western Scheldt, the waterway connecting the previously liberated North Sea port of Antwerp. This battle, often forgotten, was decisive for the subsequent liberation of Western Europe.

Travel through history, starting with the rise of fascism and Nazism until the outbreak of the Second World War. Learn about the German invasion, the persecution of the Jews, the resistance and the liberation. Read personal stories and discover silent witnesses to the war in Zeeland. You’ll find these throughout the museum as well as outside it at the Bevrijdingspark Zeeland (Liberation Park Zeeland).

On your journey, you will see the effect of the horrors of war on both soldiers and civilians. Their suffering, pain, fear and grief are still palpable when listening to and reading their testimonies or examining the numerous photographs. The museum also focuses on the wartime experiences of the sailors of the merchant navy, as well as those of the Dutch forces deployed to the Dutch East Indies following the Second World War.
Facilities: Museumwinkel, Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Biesbosch MuseumEiland
Description_Text:
The Biesbosch MuseumEiland is located in the heart of the Biesbosch National Park. The permanent collection is housed in seven pavilions, all with a different theme, and shows you how the Biesbosch developed into the national park it is today.

At Biesbosch Museumeiland you experience the challenges and opportunities that water presents us with. Discover how the Biesbosch fresh water tidal zone was formed after a flood in 1421.

Indoor museum
The people, their economic activities, crafts and nature: all this is addressed in the seven themed pavilions.

Outdoor museum
The Biesbosch MuseumEiland is a great starting point for a hike or bike ride. The Pannekoek is the Biesbosch outdoor museum, an osier bed of eight hectares where willows are cultivated and chopped, not cut down. The land is not suited to planting anything but willows because it is located on marshy fringes of rivers. The area can be reached over land and has many footpaths.

Waterspeeltuin De Biesbosch Beleving
The Biesbosch Beleving, a water playground, is located next to the museum. The Biesbosch ensures the surrounding higher-laying areas are not easily flooded. But how do they do this? Experience the Biesbosch beleving or Biesbosch experience, a 30-meter square scale model of the Biesbosch region, including polders, dikes and streams. See the confluence of meltwater from the Rhine and rainwater from the Meuse in the Biesbosch delta. Watch the water level rise. Move the sliders and press the buttons to influence the course of the water! The Biesbosch beleving is in operation from April to October.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Boerderijmuseum De Bovenstreek
Description_Text:
Farm life changed radically in the last century. Come see how people in the Veluwe region lived, worked and farmed at the Boerderijmuseum De Bovenstreek.

At Boerderijmuseum De Bovenstreek you find out more about living on a farm in the past. The museum farm includes the living quarters furnished as farms were around 1900 and the farm working area. The living quarters includes a ‘heerd’, the hearth and the original closet-beds.

Traditional costumes of the Veluwe region
The museum exhibits all sorts of useful household and farm items and an exceptionally beautiful and complete collection of traditional costumes of the northern Veluwe region. Many farming items and tools are displayed on the threshing floor and working area of the barn. The garden and the grounds look just as they would have in the past, meticulously preserved in the traditional style of the region.

Livestock
Come see a complete farmyard with tools, wagon shed, haystacks, livestock like sheep, chickens and goats, and an apiary. The vegetable garden and orchard with older types of fruit are here too. The museum hosts temporary themed exhibitions annually.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Bonnefanten
Description_Text:
The Bonnefanten stands out on the Maastricht skyline. This art museum stands at the crossroads of tradition and innovation. A museum of historic, modern and contemporary art.

Connections
The Bonnefanten aims to connect the arts world with society and challenges us to understand the world we live in better. The collection has a clear signature of its own, not least because very few of the usual suspects are represented there.

Hidden gems
The artists take up an unconventional, striking position, which does justice to their belief in a more diversified and pluralistic attitude to the history of art. The collection focuses on lesser-known figures from art history and their hidden gems rather than mainstream artists.
Facilities: Museumwinkel, Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Boomkwekerijmuseum
Description_Text:
Boskoop is the largest contiguous tree nursery in the world, and home to the Tree Nursery Museum. Explore the history of tree nurseries from the Middle Ages onwards, and discover the temporary exhibitions on greenery.

The Tree Nursery Museum presents a broad perspective on the history of tree nursery. Old tools, machines and baskets are on display in the shed and the other buildings. The grower’s home (including the original closet-beds) shows how a grower’s family in 1900 lived. The museum hosts a temporary exhibition on greenery at least twice per year.

Name: Botanische Tuin De Kruidhof
Description_Text:
De Kruidhof (the herb yard) is the largest herb garden in the Netherlands. Discover the 17 themed sections, each with its own unique characteristics and collection of plants. The garden is home to around 2000 plant species.

Treat your senses to De Kruidhof!

Botanical garden De Kruidhof, next to the station in Buitenpost (on the rail line between Groningen and Leeuwarden) is the largest botanical garden in the north of the Netherlands and a unique day out for young and old alike.

17 themed gardens In this four-hectare space, discover the seventeen themed gardens, each with its own unique characteristics and collection of plants. On top of this, De Kruidhof contains the largest collection of medicinal herbs in Western Europe.

IJstijdenmuseum (ice ages museum) Also worth a visit is the IJstijdenmuseum, which is part of De Kruidhof. Travel back in time and marvel at the wondrous images and stories. The museum is worth visiting for young and old alike.

Fun for children There’s plenty to do for children. De Kruidhof offers a beautiful natural playground and, starting this year, an educational scavenger hunt, free of charge.

Eettuin Want to relax after taking everything in? Drink a fresh cup of coffee or have lunch at the Eettuin. The Eettuin is also a perfect place for a family gathering, wedding or office outing.

Shop Visit the shop offering local and garden products for a permanent reminder. The garden shop is full of beautiful flowers, plants, trees and fruit trees grown at De Kruidhof.

Looking for more information? Go to www.dekruidhof.nl/en/.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Botanische Tuin Kerkrade
Description_Text: The Botanische Tuin Kerkrade’s collection consists of 195 different plant families. Come see the most extraordinary flora.

Name: Botanische Tuinen Universiteit Utrecht
Description_Text:
The Utrecht University Botanic Gardens cover nine hectares and are overflowing with natural splendor. Discover the enormous rock garden, evolution garden, tropical greenhouses and the bird-watching hut in and around Fort Hoofddijk.

The miniature waterfall cascades gently, butterflies and other insects fly and crawl around to their heart’s content and a frog pops its head above water. Six gardens – each in their own style – are found in and around Fort Hoofddijk.

Discover the various gardens
For example, tall herbs that originate in mountain valleys are cultivated in the Rock garden . In the Discovery garden , you can see, smell, feel, taste, and even hear the plants. Follow a trail through millions of years of evolution in the Evolution garden . Visit the greenhouses with their tropical and subtropical plants, including many types of orchids, an apiary and a bird-watching hut where you can spot birds and learn all about our feathered friends. At the entrance, you can buy a great gift or enjoy a cup of coffee or lunch on the terrace.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Brabants Museum Oud Oosterhout
Description_Text:
Hidden among the trees lies a miniature city with 270 buildings. On top of that, Brabants Museum Oud Oosterhout illustrates rural life in Brabant through 100 dolls.

Brabants Museum Oud Oosterhout consists of a park with a 270-building miniature city, an indoor museum and a ‘Flemish shed’ displaying traditional crafts.

Life in Brabant
The ‘Flemish shed’ houses a washing room and a shoemaker’s shop. The interior museum consists of a living room furbished in the Brabantian style of the early 20th century. Upstairs, 100 dolls illustrate the rural life in Brabant.

Historic Dutch games
The museum is a lot of fun for children, too, with traditional Dutch games, scavenger hunts and a large playground. Walk on stilts, play with hoops or discover a historic classroom.
Facilities: Museumwinkel, Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Brandweermuseum Hellevoetsluis
Description_Text:
The Brandweermuseum Hellevoetsluis (Hellevoetsluis firefighters’ museum) displays an extensive collection of firefighting equipment, ranging from early tools dating from 1550 to modern systems. For children, the museum offers a themed scavenger hunt.

The Brandweermuseum Hellevoetsluis is housed in two former navy buildings. Discover the history of firefighting and emergency management in the Netherlands. This unique collection is one of Europe’s largest.

A grand collection
The museum displays an extensive collection of firefighting equipment, ranging from early tools dating from 1550 to modern systems. Marvel at the collection of handheld extinguishers, beautifully decorated pumps and dozens of leather buckets. Unique pumps from Soestdijk Palace stand alongside the wheelbarrow-mounted pumps used by early company fire brigades. Highlights include the historic fire engines, some of which still work, and the bright red fire trucks with their shiny brass trim: the legendary Ahrens-Fox engine with the distinctive accumulator on top of the pump, and its deluxe Italian Fiat engine.

Name: Brutus
Description_Text:
With 6,000 square meters of exhibition space, Brutus ranks among the largest institutions for contemporary art in the Netherlands.

Artist-Driven Playground
At Brutus, artists take center stage. They are given complete freedom to realize their ideas and dreams—no matter how bold. Brutus provides a platform for exhibitions that other museums shy away from due to their scale, complexity, or daring nature. The result is an exciting mix of large-scale installations, theater performances, film screenings, and vibrant parties.

Name: Buitenplaats Kasteel Wijlre
Address: Kerkpad / In de Beemden  1 6321 PX Wijlre
Description_Text:
Kasteel Wijlre estate brings together contemporary art, architecture, cultural heritage, and nature.

Kasteel Wijlre estate brings together contemporary art, architecture, cultural heritage, and nature. Nestled in the rolling hills of South Limburg, the estate's expansive gardens and historic park surrounding the castle and carriage house offer a unique setting for contemplation and discovery. The Hedge House – designed by architect Wiel Arets – combines an exhibition space with an orchid greenhouse and chicken coop, reflecting the symbiosis between art and nature.

Originally a private initiative by art collectors Jo and Marlies Eyck, the estate became an independent public institution in 2015. Each year, it presents an international programme of exhibitions and public events. Monumental, site-specific works by artists such as Giuseppe Penone and Peter Struycken engage in dialogue with the landscape. Recent exhibitions have featured work by Jean-Marc Bustamante , Elspeth Diederix , Tala Madani , Thierry Oussou , Kerry James Marshall , Otobong Nkanga , and Joëlle Tuerlinckx .

Experience the tranquillity and beauty of one of Europe’s most enchanting gardens. Stroll along the castle’s moat, discover contemporary sculptures nestled in lush greenery, and be inspired by the interplay of art, nature, and architecture.

Name: Bureau Europa
Description_Text:
Take a new look at the ‘designed environment’, in the exhibitions and activities at Bureau Europa, the Maastricht institute for architecture and design with a view on Europe and the Meuse-Rhine Euroregion.

This is the perfect place for urban development, planning and design. At Bureau Europa, there are plenty of things to see, hear and learn. Bureau Europa organizes varied exhibitions, tours, workshops and lectures.

With all these activities, Bureau Europa is the knowledge center for anyone interested in the social and public domain.

Name: CODA
Description_Text:
CODA Museum is the place for new exhibitions by regional, national and international artists. The temporary exhibitions focus on jewelry and art, made of and on paper.

Museum, library and archive
Look, listen, experience and discover at CODA! Having a museum, a library and an archive under a single roof results in cross-pollination between art, literature and history. The museum focuses on the visitor experience. CODA tells, preserves and displays stories by and about people in lively, interactive presentations based on authentic artefacts.

Name: Centraal Museum
Description_Text:
Want to see the world’s largest collection of work by Gerrit Rietveld as well as Dick Bruna’s studio? Visit the Centraal Museum in Utrecht! It also displays traditional, modern and applied art, fashion and city history.

The Centraal Museum’s collection consists of over 60,000 objets d’art, a fine selection of which is displayed in the galleries and during exhibitions. Be swept away into the wonderful world of various art forms. Discover the work of the icons of the art world such as Rietveld, Koch, Baburen, Dumas and Bruna. The Centraal Museum is also worth a visit for its archaeological history. Discover all kinds of special finds, including a well-known ship from 11th-century Utrecht.

In short, the Centraal Museum is the meeting point of history and culture. The whole family will have a fun day out.

Name: Chabot Museum
Description_Text:
The Chabot Museum for international Expressionism is housed in a modernist architectural gem. Find out more about the life and work of artist Henk Chabot, his contemporaries, and kindred spirits.

Expressionism
An ongoing series of temporary exhibitions highlight the versatility of the Dutch artist Henk Chabot (1894-1949). His extensive repertoire of paintings, drawings, statues and graphic art shares many stylistic similarities with the Dutch expressionists, such as Charley Toorop and Herman Kruyder.

Rotterdam
Chabot and Rotterdam are inseparably intertwined. Chabot is known as an unconventional expressionist, a painter of farmers, gardeners, the Dutch landscape along the Rotte river, and of course his most famous work, Brand van Rotterdam (The Fire of Rotterdam).

Name: Comenius Museum
Description_Text:
The Comenius Museum is dedicated to the life and work of the famous Czech theologist, philosopher and pedagogue Jan Amos Comenius (1592-1670).

The famous Czech academic Jan Amos Comenius (1592-1670) spent the last fourteen years of his life in the Netherlands. The Comenius Museum is dedicated to his life and works.

Comenius’ world
The permanent exhibition Mundus Comenii (Comenius’ world) offers insights into all aspects of Jan Amos Comenius’ life, his work and the era in which he lived. Learn about the four major themes in his life: Religio, Respublica Litteraria, Scientia et Educatio and Politica. The permanent exhibition is located on the ground floor.

Mausoleum
His mausoleum is accessible via the museum. The mausoleum was decorated by Czech artists commissioned by the Czech government during the mid-1930’s.

Library
The museum contains a modest library that has a number of Comenius’ original books and works on his life. The library can be visited by appointment.

Name: Cruquius Museum
Description_Text:
Marvel at the power of 19th-century steam engines and the ageless battle against the sea. The Cruquius Museum tells the story of the reclamation of the Haarlemmermeer.

Drainage
Former steam pumping station Cruquius is one of three such locations used to reclaim the Haarlemmermeer (Haarlem lake) between 1848 and 1852. The building is a great example of the Gothic Revival industrial architecture of the 19th century. After thorough renovations, the building has been nearly returned to its original state. The pumping station has been a national heritage site since 1973.

Renovations
The interior of the Cruquius Museum was completely renovated in 2020. The no-nonsense interactive presentation highlights the best aspects of this national heritage site. Cruquius Museum presents the story of the battle against water using steam technology. The exhibition is contemporary and interesting for all.

Flood control
Together with two other pumping stations, the Cruquius reclaimed the huge and dangerous Haarlemmermeer 170 years ago. King William I of the Netherlands played a major part in this huge achievement. He decided to reclaim the huge inland lake, using new steam technologies. The museum combines old steam engines with modern movies and interactive audiovisual media. The result is an overview of water management, the development of steam technology and the people behind the largest Cornish engine in the world. The highlight of a visit? A demonstration of the largest steam engine in the world!
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Cultuur-Historisch Museum Sorgdrager
Description_Text:
Want to know what makes an Amelanders different? Visit the Cultuurhistorisch museum Sorgdrager to find out more about the cultural history of the island.

Cultuurhistorisch museum Sorgdrager is all about the history and stories of Ameland. Find out more about the role the island played in the whaling industry and marvel at the collection of Ameland furniture.

Sorgdragerhuuske
Cultuurhistorisch museum Sorgdrager is housed in the Sorgdragershuuske, the governor’s residence built in 1751 by Pieter Cornelis Sorgdrager.

Unique items tell the story of the island’s culture and the rich history of Ameland and its residents. Find out more about whaling, the lives of the Cammingha family and their mansion, explore the open repository and marvel at the lavishly decorated furniture and jewelry from times gone by.

Name: Cultuurforum Aardenburg
Description_Text:
An archaeological adventure! Many Roman and medieval objects have been found in the soil around Aardenburg. Museum Aardenburg tells the story of the past through these finds.

The city of Aardenburg
Aardenburg is one of the oldest cities in the Zwinstreek region and has existed for nearly 2000 years. The Romans built a fort in what is now Aardenburg. A village then developed around it. In later times, many Roman and medieval objects were found in the soil around Aardenburg.

The museum
A number of these Roman and medieval finds are on display in the museum, which tells the story of the people who lived in Aardenburg in those days. Discover what they ate and drank, where they lived and which gods they worshipped.

Name: Czaar Peterhuisje
Description_Text:
The Czar Peter House is one of the oldest wooden houses in the Netherlands. Czar Peter the Great stayed in this house when he was studying to become a shipwright. Czars, royalty and even Napoleon visited this house.

The Czar Peter House, built in 1632, is one of the oldest wooden houses in the Netherlands. Czar Peter the Great stayed in this house in 1697, when he was studying to become a shipwright in Zaandam.

An eight-day stay
Czar Peter the Great lived in this house in Zaandam, which belonged to blacksmith Gerrit Kist, for a mere eight days. After this the Czar moved to the shipyards in Amsterdam owned by the Dutch East India Company (VOC). Even so, the wooden laborer’s house became famous and the Czar’s name has become attached to it.

Names carved in glass
Many people of importance, like Czars, Dutch royalty and even Napoleon and Empress Sissi, have visited the house. Their names are carved in the glass windows and wooden walls prove it.

Two monuments on one site
In the 19th century the wooden house was strutted, given a new foundation and covered over to protect it. The wooden house and the protective roof are now national heritage sites. This means Zaandam has two monuments on a single site.

Name: DAF Museum
Description_Text:
Go from one surprise to another at DAF Museum in Eindhoven. Discover the milestones in DAF’s history, ranging from trucks and cars to prototypes.

The museum focuses on the history of Van Doorne’s Automobielfabriek (Van Doorne’s Automobile Factory), i.e. DAF. It houses a multitude of DAF vehicles, sportscars and prototypes, such as the ‘royal beach car’.

From rally truck to tow truck
A part of the museum is dedicated to its large truck collection. Marvel at historic vehicles like cargo trucks, buses and specialized military trucks and fire trucks, as well as a concrete mixer and a tow truck. The museum also exhibits a number of trucks used for racing and rallying.

Name: De Appel
Description_Text:
De Appel brings people, objects and ideas together to discover the unknown. It also offers time and space for artists and allies to pose vital questions.

The program addresses intellectually and emotionally curious art lovers of all backgrounds with an experimental, open and inclusive approach.

Name: De Casteelse Poort
Description_Text:
De Casteelse Poort in Wageningen presents a fascinating perspective on the history of this city on the Rhine. Two permanent exhibitions cover local history and the war years.

De Casteelse Poort is the cultural and historical center of Wageningen. The museum presents a fascinating view on the history of this city on the Rhine. Marvel at models, paintings, photographs and historic objects. Aside from temporary exhibitions, De Casteelse Poort also houses two permanent exhibitions.

5,000 years of history
The exhibition History of Wageningen covers 5,000 years of local history. Due to its strategically important location, Wageningen has suffered much in war. In World War II, Wageningen was in the firing line. But it was also where German forces signed the capitulation. This period of history is the focus of the exhibition Wageningen ’40-’45 .

German capitulation
In the Netherlands, Wageningen is famous for being the city where the German forces in the Netherlands signed orders on their surrender in 1945. The museum offers a permanent exhibition on this topic. Towards the end of World War II, the city was selected for the signing of the German surrender document. Hotel De Wereld was specially chosen because of its name. Wageningen proudly calls itself the ‘City of Liberation’.

Name: De Fraeylemaborg
Description_Text:
Fraeylemaborg is located in an imposing park. Visit the borg to see how nobility lived in the past.

Imposing estate
Fraeylemaborg is surrounded by vast gardens in the style of an English country estate. Visit the castle to see how the wealthy and their staff lived in the past. The last resident had a mix of centuries-old heirlooms and recent purchases, including work by Gerrit van Houten (1866-1934), also known as Gerry Wood.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: De Glasblazerij
Description_Text:
Discover the art of glassblowing at the Glasblazerij (Glassblower’s workshop) in Leerdam. Examine the unique glass art, and watch the glassblowers at work. Want to get to work yourself? Learn how to make glass at one of our workshops.

In 1997, the Glas Centrum was founded in a former wood warehouse. This workshop was renamed Glasblazerij in January 2008.

The past, present and future of glassblowing
At the Glasblazerij, the past, present and future come together. Discover the gleaming history of glassblowing, and marvel at contemporary glass art. The Glasblazerij is preparing for the future by teaching the centuries-old art of glassblowing.

Name: De Hollandsche Manege
Description_Text:
De Hollandsche Manege in Amsterdam is the oldest urban riding school in The Netherlands.  It brings to life the history of horse riding, from riding school to dressage (and, of course, all the appropriate riding outfits).

Experience history
Travel back in time at the Levend Paardenmuseum (Living Horse Museum) in De Hollandsche Manege , in the historic setting of the oldest riding school of the Netherlands. The world of horse riding comes to life. Come see classic horse-riding art and outfits at the carousel demonstrations.

Name: De Kuiperij
Description_Text:
At the Zaanse Schans, you can visit The Cooperage. Find out more about the traditional craft of making barrels. All of the tools and materials inside once belonged to cooperage and barrel-maker S.R. Tiemstra & Sons in Oostzanerwerf. When the last cooper, Jaap Tiemstra, died, he left behind the full cooperage and its inventory.

Demonstrations
The tools, machines, barrels and all other contents of the cooperage are now at the Zaanse Schans. Jaap Tiemstra’s cooperage is brought to life at the Zaans Museum. Enthusiastic volunteers inform visitors and demonstrate the traditional craft of making barrels.

Name: De Looierij
Description_Text:
From cow to leather, in a building that exudes the history of tanning. Follow the tannery route through the museum, which is housed in an old tannery that was built in 1889, and learn all there is to know about the production of leather and the life of tanners.

Beamhouse
The different steps of the tanning process are explained in the beamhouse. Children can participate in workshops in the atelier. Works of art by artists from Dongen are exhibited in the New Beamhouse. All the exhibited work is inspired by leather, tanning or a theme relating to Dongen.
Facilities: Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: De Mesdag Collectie
Address: Laan van Meerdervoort 7f 2517 AB Den Haag
Description_Text:
The renowned marine painter Hendrik Willem Mesdag and his wife Sientje were art collectors who had their own museum. Their collection of 19th century art can still be visited.

The Mesdags began collecting paintings they admired in 1866, and over their lives they amassed a truly exceptional collection. The main focus is on the Barbizon school and The Hague School. The museum houses the largest Barbizon collection outside of France. Hendrik Willem Mesdag collected applied arts to decorate his house and museum. He acquired many ceramic pieces by Theodoor Colenbrander, as well as Japanese vases and other exotic objects.

Name: De Museumfabriek Enschede
Description_Text:
At De Museumfabriek, Enschede, there’s no need to keep your distance.  Let the museum surprise and amaze you. Don’t just observe, join in!

The wonders of science
De Museumfabriek is a museum about the wonders of science. Discover the stunning natural and cultural history collections, the exhibitions in the Cabinet of Curiosities (Wunderkammer), fascinating workshops and various activities for young and old alike.

Makerspace
Your creativity is given free rein in the Makerspace. Create amazing objects using the 3D printer, laser cutter, foam cutter and other equipment.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: De Nieuwe Kerk
Description_Text:
The Nieuwe Kerk is one of Amsterdam’s most impressive monuments. It has been known for decades for its high-profile exhibitions of art, photography, and inspiring people and cultures.

A royal church
De Nieuwe Kerk Amsterdam is world famous for its beautiful architecture, the changing exhibitions. The church, more than six centuries old, is located in the heart of the city, on Dam square.

High-profile
For decades, De Nieuwe Kerk Amsterdam has been known for its high-profile exhibitions about art, photography, and inspiring individuals and cultures. With an average of 250,000 visitors a year, it is one of the most popular exhibition venues in the Netherlands. It also plays a role of national significance, hosting royal ceremonies, official gatherings, and cultural events.
One of Amsterdam’s most impressive historical monuments, De Nieuwe Kerk is a place of inspiration, commemoration, and celebration in Dam Square, the heart of the city.

Name: De Pont museum
Description_Text:
De Pont is a museum of contemporary art, located in a former woolen mill in Tilburg. The private collection now includes more than 800 works by around 75 artists.

De Pont is an independent museum of contemporary art, located in a former woolen mill. Benthem Crouwel Architects transformed the industrial building with its characteristic saw-tooth roof into a separate exhibition space with loads of natural light. The building features both large open spaces and smaller spaces in what used to be storage rooms.
The museum opened its doors in 1992, and a new wing for photo and video presentations was added in 2016. The new wing connects to a spacious cafe and a wonderful garden.
The varying exhibition program offers an interesting mixture of paintings, sculptures, installations, performances, films and photos. The program follows the development of artists over a longer period of time.
In the WOOL project room, work by promising artists, new assets and special projects are exhibited. These projects make sure De Pont’s program keeps in step with the times.

The museum is named after Tilburg attorney and businessman Jan de Pont (1915-1987). De Pont left part of his estate to stimulate contemporary visual art.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Design Museum Den Bosch
Description_Text:
Design Museum Den Bosch shows the influence of design on our daily lives and tells their backstory.

The Design Museum Den Bosch organizes eight to ten exhibitions per year in its three exhibition halls.

Cultural debate
The museum is interested in cultural debate on design and the role it plays in society. Lectures, workshops and movie screenings are therefore always organized in conjunction with the exhibitions. Design Museum Den Bosch added the post-human collection area in 2017.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Diamant Museum Amsterdam
Description_Text:
The Diamond Museum Amsterdam takes you back 3 billion years to the formation of the Earth’s surface. Zoom in down to the level of a single carbon atom and marvel at the world’s smallest cut diamond.

Diamond history
Be enchanted by sparkling gemstones and discover 400 years of diamond history in the only diamond museum in Europe. Meet the specialists who can transform a rough stone to a sparkling jewel, learn to distinguish between a real and a fake diamond, and marvel at rare diamonds from all over the world.

Diamonds and jewelry
The Diamond Museum, located in the heart of Amsterdam, a stone’s throw from the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh Museum, is a must for anybody interested in diamonds and jewelry. The exhibition takes you back in time, and shows how diamonds are cut and processed. Learn why people developed a soft spot for the hardest material known to man and how power and wealth influenced the popularity of diamonds. The Diamond Museum Amsterdam also features a lovely historic collection with reproductions of tiaras and crowns.

Permanent collection
In addition, the museum has a unique permanent collection with famous pieces, such as the Katana sword (Japanese) made from Murano glass with 1,967 diamonds and 494 rubies, the smallest diamond ever cut, and the Diamond Ape Skull. This skull is bejeweled with 17,000 brilliant diamonds and is inspired by the diamond-encrusted human skull from Damien Hirst.

Name: Discovery Museum
Description_Text:
Discovery Museum is a hands-on interactive discovery center that will overwhelm your senses, where you can learn about how the world works.

Discovery Museum is the largest museum of science and technology in the south of the Netherlands. The museum’s Treasury displays Limburg’s industrial heritage.

A world to discover
Discovery Museum offers a wide variety of activities: interactive exhibitions on science, stunning and unique films (on the future of the earth, for instance), exhibitions on innovative products, educational workshops (such as computer programming) and creative lab spaces where you can get to work yourself – with some help or on your own.

Limburg’s heritage
The Treasury at the Discovery Museum is where the main exhibits tell their story: steam engines and motors, miners’ tools and pottery, porcelain, glass and crystal from Maastricht.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Dolhuys | Museum van de geest
Description_Text:
Museum of the Mind | Dolhuys has been completely renovated and reopened at the end of 2020. The museum invites you on an interactive voyage of discovery into the mind. This is not as simple as one might think.  What exactly is the mind? Does it exist inside or outside of your body? Can you influence your mind, and if so, how? Discover more about your own mind and the minds of others through personal stories, science, art and philosophical questions.

Controlling your mind
The museum does not send you off on your own. Through the digital tour guide, you will even hear the walls speak. They will guide you, ask you critical questions and challenge you. Just how empathetic are you? And what kind of personality to do you have? Meet scientists and philosophers that have been trying to find out how to control the mind for ages. Contemporary thinkers, rappers and artists tell their stories as well. Visitors gain insights about how they judge the world, for we all have an instinctive tendency to want to pigeonhole the human mind.

Art
In addition to its heritage collection, the Museum of the Mind is also building an art collection that presents a different view of reality – regular artworks that challenge what is standard, as well as spontaneous and unconventional works of art, often by self-taught artists who operate outside traditional professional art circuits: Outsider Art .
Facilities: Museumwinkel, Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Dordrechts Museum
Description_Text:
Starting in 1842 with just one painting, the Dordrechts Museum has acquired an internationally renowned collection since. It covers over six centuries of painting, from the 16th century to the present day.

Ary Scheffer
The Dordrechts Museum is a favorite for fans of Ary Scheffer, one of Dordrecht’s greatest painters. The Dordrechts Museum has the world’s largest collection of Scheffer’s art. The collection is very varied, including historic, modern and contemporary art. You can also discover art by other painters from Dordrecht, such as Aelbert Cuyp and Ferdinand Bol.  The collection’s more recent artists include Jan Toorop, Pyke Koch, Karel Appel and Armando.

Activities
The Dordrechts Museum organizes activities for visitors of all ages. The tours, workshops and masterclasses are tailor-made for current exhibitions.

Inclusivity
The Dordrechts Museum considers it important for everyone to realize that art is also for them. For people suffering from dementia and their loved ones, we have a monthly Amazement Tour at the museum. The museum also offers guided tours for the deaf and hard of hearing Dutch Sign Language , given by deaf guides.

Name: Drawing Centre Diepenheim
Description_Text:
Somewhat off the beaten path, you’ll find Drawing Centre Diepenheim, presenting contemporary drawings in a way that gives the visitor space and time for close observation, discussion, and appreciation of art and nature.

About the Drawing Centre
Drawing Centre Diepenheim is the stage for artistic drawings in the Netherlands. Its exhibitions, publications and public programs are developed from the perspective of a basic curiosity about the role and meaning of drawing within contemporary art in practice. The Drawing Centre also offers residencies, master classes and an educational program.

Drawing Centre Diepenheim is located in the region of Twente (province of Overijssel) and is surrounded by gardens and historical estates. It is a special place off the beaten path where visitors have the space and time for close observation and discussion, and to experience drawing as a means of discovering and understanding the world around us.

Gardens
The wonderful outdoor collection of Drawing Center Diepenheim is the gardens, where various artists exhibit their vision on gardens, nature and landscapes.
Facilities: Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Drents Museum
Description_Text:
The Drents Museum has all you could need for a great day out, for young and old alike. It gives you a view on the world and offers a view of Drenthe province, with stories about archaeology, art and history.

The period rooms show how wealthy Drenthe families of the previous century lived. Immerse yourself in the history and culture of Drenthe. Codename: Energy is an exhilarating adventure for families with children. The museum mounts various national and international exhibitions of archaeology, contemporary realism and art from 1885 to 1935.

The archaeology department is currently closed due to an expansion to the museum.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Drents Museum De Buitenplaats
Description_Text:
There is something to discover for everyone in the Drents Museum De Buitenplaats.

New direction
Drents Museum De Buitenplaats in Eelde is open again! Under a new name and with a new direction. From 2024, Drents Museum De Buitenplaats will be a full part of the Drents Museum in Assen. In the renovated museum, the Art Nouveau coast takes center stage, based on the Drents Museum's collection of art around 1900.

Northern Figuratives
The De Buitenplaats ensemble includes the 20th-century museum pavilion and permanent garden and the 17th-century Nijsinghhuis with murals of the Northern Figuratives. Het Drentse Landschap owns the ensemble and is responsible for its management.

Keep an eye on the website of Drents Museum De Buitenplaats for the current exhibition, admission prices, and other events.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Drukkerijmuseum Meppel
Description_Text:
Lead, ink and pounding presses. At Drukkerijmuseum Meppel, the printing presses are always working. Children can get to work in the children’s printworks.

Try it yourself
Experience printing a page using old, artisan techniques, like printing a text using lead type. Feel like a real printer and watch as the pounding presses print ink onto paper. Make your own paper in a large, old barrel filled with cellulose and lots of water.

###Tours and demonstrations
The museum offers tours on all days except Saturdays. Enthusiastic volunteers give detailed explanations and demonstrate how the presses work. For children, the museum offers different activities every day. Children can get to work in the children’s printworks. There’s also a scavenger hunt, with a small reward at the end.
Facilities: Museumwinkel, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Edams Museum
Description_Text:
Discover how a 16th-century merchant lived at the Edam Museum. Explore the period rooms in the city hall, the office with its money chest and payment table, and the cellar floor floating on groundwater at the merchant’s house.

The Edam Museum is the oldest museum north of the river IJ in the province of North Holland, and is therefore one of the oldest in the Netherlands. Housed at two characteristic sites in the old city, the museum illustrates Edam’s rich history, from shipbuilding, ceramics and architecture to renowned families and everyday life. The collection consists of paintings, engravings and items once owned by the family. The museum is housed in two separate locations:

The ‘Steenen Coopmanshuys’ (stone merchant’s house) – Damplein 8
Edam’s first merchant house built in stone dates back to 1540-1550. The building was purchased by the municipality in 1893 and turned into a museum in 1895.

Edam city hall – Damplein 1
Although Edam received city rights in 1357, the city hall only dates to 1737. It was built in the Louis XIV style: majestic, pompous and symmetrical. Part of the museum is located one floor up. The two grand period rooms offer a beautiful view of Edam as well as an annual temporary exhibition.

Name: Elisabeth Weeshuis Museum
Description_Text:
History comes to life at the Elisabeth Orphanage Museum! Discover how orphans in Culemborg lived 400 years ago. Come along and discover how being a child today differs from being a child in the past.

700 orphans
For 4 centuries, the Elisabeth Orphanage was home to around 700 orphans. Children that had lost their parents were brought to the stately orphanage in the city of Culemborg – a whole new world for them. Today the building houses a family museum and garden where you can experience what life was like in those days. Have fun exploring the authentic orphanage kitchen, the dining room, the historic cellar, spinning room, dormitory, play area in the attic and the garden.

Activities for children
There’s always plenty to do in the orphanage. Help Kaat the kitchen maid do the laundry or churn butter. Harvest vegetables in the garden and play the garden game in the hedge maze. The attic offers a nice play area, and there are fun and tasty activities related to the theme year on food: ‘Enough for an entire orphanage!’.

Name: Embassy of the Free Mind
Description_Text:
The Embassy of the Free Mind is a museum library housed in a historic building dating back to 1622: Keizergracht 123, Amsterdam. The library presents a platform for free thought, inspired by the ideology of the Bibliotheca Philosophica Hermetica . Visit the café and garden. Marvel at the beautiful prints, taken from the works of 17th-century freethinkers and others. Feel welcome.

Free thought is the capacity to formulate your own thoughts and ideas – independently, without boundaries or constraints and regardless of religion, culture and age.

What does the museum offer?
The museum captures the imagination through 200 images from its collection. Discover the story behind each one! Take an audio tour, marvel at the treasures of our collection in the Kleine Sael - small hall - attend a lunchtime concert in the Grote Sael - great hall - or sign up for a guided tour through the house. Discover the collection and examine the books in the reading room and the lounge or find a place to enjoy a cup of coffee or tea in the café or the extensive garden. You can enjoy our vibrant online program of lectures and courses from home, too.

Amsterdam and free thought
How is it that, all over the world, Amsterdam is associated with freedom? It is in the city’s DNA. And freedom is what every human truly longs for. Humans are the only creatures that search for truth and freedom, and want to know the whys and wherefores of everything around them. But there’s no freedom without wisdom. Wisdom transcends such phenomena as dictated truth, superstition, prejudice and fundamentalism. Wisdom connects us all, and creates freedom. Since the 17th century, Amsterdam has been famous for its freedom of religion, individual freedom and freedom of the press. Back then, books functioned as the internet does today: they spread knowledge and connected people.

House with Heads
The Embassy of the Free Mind is located in the unique 17th-century city palace known as the House with Heads . This national heritage site was designed by Hendrick de Keyser in 1622. Six heads adorn the facade of the building. These represent the Roman deities Apollo, Ceres, Mercury, Minerva, Bacchus and Diana.

Name: Eusebiuskerk Arnhem
Description_Text:
St. Eusebius’ Church tells the twelve centuries of history of Arnhem, Gelderland’s unique capital. Under the rule of Charles II, Duke of Guelders, the city was a center of trade and power.

The St. Eusebius’ Church suffered terribly in the Second World War, especially in 1944-1945, just as the people of Arnhem did. The city regained its pride when the church was rebuilt after the war.

Name: Eye Filmmuseum
Description_Text:
Watch new movies and the most beautiful cinematic classics in the spectacular Eye building on the river IJ. As well as a permanent collection, the museum also hosts four major temporary exhibitions per year. Note: Eye reopened on June 1. The permanent presentation will remain temporarily closed and the scavenger hunt and Eye walk video tour are not available for the time being.

The spectacular Eye building on the river IJ is a real eye-catcher. The Eye Film Museum presents four major temporary exhibitions per year. The ground floor includes Panorama: a permanent exhibition with main exhibits from the movie museum’s collection and various interactive installations. Panorama displays film-making equipment that marks big moments in the history of cinema, including a 35 mm Mitchell camera, a mutoscope and a magic lantern. The equipment showcases the quest of passionate inventors and visionaries to capture moving pictures. The museum answers questions such as how were movies made in the past, what did cinema equipment in the past look like and what technical developments have taken place in the movie industry?

Classics and green screens
Watch the latest movies and the greatest cinematic classics in the cinema, often accompanied by live music, a lecture or a special guest. There’s plenty for children to experience at Eye too, from workshops to scavenger hunts and from a video tour to a green screen .

Name: Feyenoord Museum
Description_Text:
Feyenoord: a legendary soccer club. Take a tour of De Kuip, where the past meets the present. As you enter Feyenoord Museum through the old players’ tunnel, you will travel back in time through the history of the club, its stadium and people.

A trip through time at De Kuip
Take a trip through time at the Feyenoord Museum. Experience the history of Feyenoord from its founding by Queen Wilhelmina in 1908 to the most recent national championship in 2023. Special objects, photographs, films and stories tell the memorable history of the club. Walk along the different highlights of the De Kuip such as the players’ tunnel, the official gallery and the historic Olympia side of the stadium.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Flessenscheepjesmuseum
Description_Text:
The Flessenscheepjes Museum in Enkhuizen has more than one thousand ships-in-a-bottle from various periods and parts of the world.

Hundreds of bottles, large and small
Everybody has seen a ship in a bottle somewhere. Perhaps you even have one in your home, or maybe even two? But the largest collection in the world can be found at the Flessenscheepjes Museum in Enkhuizen. The historic 16th-century sluice house has more than one thousand such bottles, of every possible shape and size and from every part of the world. They were made in a variety of periods, for example, the Dutch East India Company (VOC) period. Marvel at the magic of a ship in a bottle and discover how it was piloted into its home port. View the permanent video presentation to discover all about the ship in a bottle phenomenon.

The sluice house
The Flessenscheepjes Museum is an institution that receives no government funding, and is located in the Spuihuisje, the 16th-century sluice house in Enkhuizen. The sluice house was built on the sluice gate of the Westfriesche Omringdijk, the West Friesland ring dike, after the first inland harbor was dug in Enkhuizen in the 14th century.

Name: Flipje en Streekmuseum Tiel
Description_Text:
Flipje- en Streekmuseum Tiel is a modern museum that presents a nostalgic look back at the history of Tiel. The museum celebrates raspberry-shaped comic book character Flipje as he teaches you about regional history and archaeology.

The jolly raspberry boy named Flipje is well-known in the Netherlands as the mascot of a popular brand of jam. Since his first appearance in 1935, he has become a symbol of the town of Tiel. This museum tells Flipje’s story. Flipje- en Streekmuseum Tiel, FEST for short, is a modern museum on the history of Tiel and Flipje.

The collection focuses mainly on food and food production. A considerable part of this focus is, naturally, on jam. The museum’s large collection covers the jam industry and well-known comic book character Flipje. The other four floors of the museum offer exhibits on archaeology, painting, silverware, porcelain and regional history, as well two temporary exhibitions each year.

Name: Florence Nightingale Instituut
Description_Text:
The online Florence Nightingale Institute (FNI) is for everyone who would like to find out more about the history of nursing and healthcare in the Netherlands.

FNI.nl is the online knowledge center for the history of nursing and healthcare. FNI.nl researches, collects and informs based on themed dossiers. The website includes a canon of nursing. Want to know more about the history of nursing and healthcare? Be inspired by the many stories, photographs, films and objects, past and present.

Note: The FNI is a virtual museum which can only be visited online .

Name: Foam Fotografiemuseum Amsterdam
Description_Text:
Foam Photography Museum is an inspiring and accessible museum in the heart of Amsterdam. Photography is here in all its forms, from artistic photographs to photojournalism.

Photography
Foam is all about photography. The museum on the Keizersgracht holds around 20 exhibitions per year. Every form of photography finds its place here: historical, contemporary and portrait photography. Photographs by young, contemporary artists are exhibited alongside iconic images by world-famous photographers. Foam pays special attention to the current themes within the world of photography as well as up-and-coming talent.  The museum comprises 3 different buildings linked by staircases and passageways.

Name: Forteiland Pampus
Description_Text:
Get a breath of fresh air on Pampus. It takes half an hour to reach Pampus by water, a wonderful experience in itself. Once you get to the fort, find out all about military secrets and history. Discover this unique UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Visit the island fort and discover 400 years of history of the province of Holland. The various experiential pathways make visiting the island a unique outing for young and old alike. Discover the many Pampus stories. Stories going back to the times of the Dutch East India Company (VOC), when ships sailed from the East on their way to Amsterdam and got into difficulties in the shallow waters off Pampus.

Pampus, a unique UNESCO World Heritage Site###
The official visitor center of the Defence Line of Amsterdam (Stelling van Amsterdam) is a unique UNESCO World Heritage Site. At Pampus, see how Amsterdam was protected by a 135 km defense line in the late 19th century. As an island fort, Pampus gave new meaning to defending the city of Amsterdam.

Name: Fotomuseum Den Haag
Description_Text:
The Hague Museum of Photography aims to be a place where people can find the space and tranquility to discover photography and focus on art, themselves, their environment and the world.

We see a fantastic stream of images pass by each day. Images that many people regard as truth. But the idea that photography equates to truth is a misnomer. Photography is an art form. You can discover the layers, meaning and context of photography at The Hague Museum of Photography. Come and focus your attention, on art, yourself, your environment and the world.

Six exhibitions per year
The Hague Museum of Photography organizes around six exhibitions per year on a broad range of periods, disciplines and genres of photographic history.

A broad approach for a wide audience
Given this broad approach – national and international, traditional and contemporary, monochrome and color, applied and autonomous – the museum has attracted a wide audience that likes to be surprised by the varied and high-quality exhibition program.
Facilities: Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Restaurant, Drinken, Museumwinkel, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Fotomuseum aan het Vrijthof
Description_Text:
Fotomuseum aan het Vrijthof is a privately-owned photography museum in the center of Maastricht. The museum holds an exhibition on a major photographer twice a year, alongside a secondary program.

The museum is housed in the Spaans Gouvernement building, which served as a palace for Charles V in the 16th century.

Photography
Over the last few years, Fotomuseum aan het Vrijthof has developed a new vision for the future by choosing to focus on the multifaceted medium of photography. The museum will put on an exhibition by a major photographer twice a year, in combination with an attractive secondary program. The common thread running through these exhibitions is their social relevance. A new and fresh museum concept, a meeting place, offering space for experimentation and new *crossovers within the cultural sector.

Name: Frans Hals Museum
Description_Text:
The Frans Hals Museum is Haarlem’s museum of fine art, with the world’s biggest collection of Frans Hals paintings. Come and enjoy Haarlem’s 16th- and 17th-century, modern and contemporary art in two beautiful historical buildings in the old city centre.

Meet Haarlem’s old, modern and contemporary art
The Frans Hals Museum is Haarlem’s museum of fine art. Home to the world’s biggest collection of Frans Hals's paintings, alongside works by famous Haarlem artists such as Judith Leyster, Cornelis van Haarlem and Jacob van Ruisdael. And discover also the museum’s rich collection of art from the 1880s to the present day, with works by Piet Mondriaan, Charley Toorop and Rineke Dijkstra.

Come and enjoy Haarlem’s 16th- and 17th-century, modern and contemporary art in two beautiful historical buildings in the old city centre.

Frans Hals
Frans Hals ranks alongside Rembrandt and Vermeer as one of the most famous, innovative artists of the Dutch 17th century. Over the centuries, his vivid, loosely-painted portraits of real authentic people have inspired visitors, and
artists too. Famous modern painters such as Manet and Van Gogh came specially to Haarlem to admire his group portraits of civic guards and other pillars of society.

View art 2x in Haarlem
Discover the Frans Hals Museum at two historical locations in Haarlem’s centuries-old city centre.

The 17th-century former home for elderly men on Groot Heiligland features attractive galleries, intimate regents’ rooms, an 18th-century doll’s house and a wonderful courtyard. See famous works by Frans Hals alongside other old, modern and contemporary art. Picture yourself centuries ago in the very place where Frans Hals himself may once have walked.

HAL - modern and contemporary art exhibitions
The Frans Hals Museum presents exhibitions of modern and contemporary art at the 17th-century Vleeshal, the former meat market on Grote Markt.

The two locations are about seven minutes’ walk apart and one museum ticket is valid for both.

Name: Frans Hals Museum Hal
Description_Text:
The Frans Hals Museum is Haarlem’s museum of fine art, with the world’s biggest collection of Frans Hals paintings. Come and enjoy Haarlem’s 16th- and 17th-century, modern and contemporary art in two beautiful historical buildings in the old city centre.

See more from a range of perspectives
The Frans Hals Museum is one museum housed in two national heritage locations in the beautiful city center of Haarlem: Hof and Hal. Old and new come together in the Frans Hals Museum: a daring mixture of old, modern and contemporary art challenges you to change your point of view.

Location Hal
Location Hal is on the Grote Markt, the center of Haarlem, and is housed in three historical buildings, all national heritage sites. The exhibitions you will find here feature mostly modern and contemporary art.

The largest number of paintings by Hals in the world, including the world-famous militia paintings, can be found at location Hof .

Name: Fries Landbouwmuseum
Description_Text:
Frisian farmers have kept cattle and farmed the land since time immemorial. The Fries Landbouwmuseum (Frisian Agricultural Museum) preserves and displays the precious traces left by these eons of agriculture.

Frisian agricultural history
The Fries Landbouwmuseum is located on a farm that has been designated as a national heritage site, just south of Leeuwarden, on the border between the city and the countryside. Explore the lively exhibition on 2000 of history of agriculture, animal husbandry, the dairy industry, agricultural mechanization, as well as farm culture and the position of the farm as the ’cathedral within the landscape’. All this makes the museum unique in the Netherlands.

Impact
At the Fries Landbouwmuseum, experience the impact of agriculture on our culture, economy, landscape and countryside, past and present. Friesland and a cooperative and private industry developed hand-in-hand, setting an example for the world.
Learn all about how farmers lived and worked in various periods and remember that they work 24/7 to provide our daily meals.
Facilities: Museumwinkel, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Fries Museum
Description_Text:
Discover your inner Frisian at the Fries Museum. The collections include stunning silverware, the diary of Mata Hari, contemporary art and slow design. Don’t miss this brand-new museum!

The Fries Museum is a lively institution in the center of the vibrant city of Leeuwarden. Step inside the modern building and be inspired by your favorite stories or artworks. Grutte Pier’s sword, a romantic painting by world-famous artist Sir Lawrence Alma-Tadema, Gerrit Benner’s enchanting landscape... Or indeed the courageous adventures of Mata Hari.

The museum is the cultural hotspot in the north of the Netherlands. Learn about topics ranging from the Middle Ages to M.C. Escher, in surprising temporary exhibitions. Immerse yourself in Frisia, from the unique period room in Hindeloopen style and the battle against the sea to trendsetting design and prominent artists such as Rembrandt and Sir Lawrence Alma-Tadema. At the Fries Verzetsmuseum, discover touching, confrontational stories that can make you think. Stories about resistance and persecution in World War II, but also about the freedom we have today. The fourth floor displays contemporary art by well-known and up-and-coming national and international artists.
Facilities: Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Fries Scheepvaart Museum
Description_Text:
At the Fries Scheepvaart Museum, travel through Frisian maritime history and the past of Sneek and its surroundings. From skûtsjesilen and the Frisian navy to the Waterpoort (water gate) in Sneek.

Ship models
The ship model section focuses on Frisian coastal navigation, inland navigation (e.g. 18th century skûtsjes), beurtvaart (to transport passengers, livestock and freight along fixed routes at fixed prices), the fishing, maritime freight and shipbuilding sectors, and the Admiralty of Friesland. The unique pleasure craft section includes older and more modern sailing yachts. The backbone of the collection consists of 300 ship models and a few real vessels.

Period rooms
The Sneker Oudheidkamer displays how traders from Sneek and Southwest Friesland used to live. Nine period rooms display various 18th and 19th century homes, from a luxurious dining room to a farm’s opkamer (a room on a slightly higher floor level, above a basement). The ice exhibition hall focuses on ice skating. The stories of the exhibits are told in many ways, via information sheets, audio tours and multimedia (short films). For the kids, there is a Children’s Museum (Kindermuseum).

Name: Fries Verzetsmuseum
Description_Text:
Listen to war stories at the Fries Verzetsmuseum. Touching and confrontational stories that make you think.

War up close
Experience the impact World War II had on Friesland. In this museum, you will get to know the people that lived in Friesland in the early 1940s. Frisians and non-Frisians alike share their experiences of the war from the vantage point of the countryside of Friesland. They faced resistance and persecution but, luckily, did not have to deal with famine (Dutch famine of 1944–1945). However, Friesland saw many refugees that had traveled a long way to find milk and food.

Resisting the occupation
The museum focuses on topics such as the air war over Friesland, the resistance movement and hiding from the Germans. The history of the spectacular raid on the jail in Leeuwarden by the Frisian resistance plays a key role in the exhibition.

Name: GRID Grafisch Museum Groningen - Tijdelijk gesloten
Description_Text:
Discover the history and future of the graphical arts at GRID. Children and adults alike can try their hand at graphical design, typesetting, printing and bookbinding.

A museum in operation
In the modern world, books, newspapers and posters are created by computers and other new technologies. At GRID, you can discover the history and future of the graphical arts. Everything still works, from the historic presses to the modern risograph, the typesetting machine and the bindery devices.

See and Do
Try your hand at designing, printing and bookbinding in the two workshops and the modern studio. Discover and experience how the Groningen artist Werkman made his unique prints at the Werkmanatelier, where a part of his original printworks is housed.

The temporary exhibitions examine the various aspects of graphical design, graphic art, and their history.

Name: Galerij Prins Willem V
Description_Text:
The Prince William V Gallery is The Hague’s hidden gem. More than 150 paintings by Old Masters from the Mauritshuis collection, including Steen, Rubens and Potter, are on display here.

The Prince William V Gallery is located in The Hague’s historic center on the Buitenhof square, five minutes’ walk from the Mauritshuis. The hall was built in 1774 by Prince William V to display his art collection. To emphasise how wealthy he was, he covered the walls from floor to ceiling with exquisite artworks. Now, the gallery houses 150 paintings by Old Masters from the Mauritshuis collection. The chandeliers and opulent curtains hearken back to the grandeur of bygone days. Immerse yourself in the grandiose world of Prince William V.

Name: Geert Groote Huis
Description_Text:
