The Kunstmuseum is a modern palace of the arts housed in an impressive Art Deco building designed by Berlage. Roam through rooms flooded with natural daylight and discover the extensive collection at one of Europe’s largest art museums.

The Kunstmuseum houses a prominent collection of modern and contemporary visual arts, fashion and other applied arts. It is the home of Piet Mondrian, exhibiting 300 of his works. His oeuvre is a clear depiction of his life and development toward abstract art. Mondrian’s works are juxtaposed with those of his predecessors and contemporaries, such as Monet, Picasso and Kandinsky, and the following generation: Sol LeWitt, Francis Bacon and Louise Bourgeois.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Lalique Museum
Description_Text:
The Lalique Museum is located in the heart of the historic center of Doesburg, near Arnhem. The museum is dedicated to the world-renown French jeweler and glass designer René Lalique (1860-1945). In addition to the permanent collection, the museum regularly hosts temporary exhibitions focusing on art from the period of around 1850-1950.

Symbolism
The Lalique Museum is located in two national heritage sites in Doesburg. The tour guides and various touchscreens in the museum provide background and insight into the symbolism and details that Lalique incorporated into his artworks. The museum also directs some of its attention to artworks from Lalique’s contemporaries, such as Jan Toorop and Marc Chagall.

The Lalique Museum houses a stylish museum cafe, where visitors can enjoy delicious coffee, luxurious pastries and a homemade lunch. When the weather is nice, the flower-filled city garden is also open. Free parking and a bus stop are located within walking distance of the museum. Unfortunately, the museum is not accessible to wheelchairs or mobility scooters. For visitors with walkers, only the rooms on the ground floor are accessible. In 2023, the Lalique Museum will be expanded to include De Commanderij, which will make the museum fully accessible to all.

Name: Landbouw-Juttersmuseum 'Swartwoude'
Description_Text:
At the Landbouw en Juttersmuseum Swartwoude meet the poacher, fisher, and beachcomber who used to roam the island and discover the unique island stories of Ameland.

Travel back in time
Meet Ritske Mooi and hear her harrowing tale, or experience a real storm. Hear the story of the stranded young castaways that decided to stay. The farmhouse area focuses on the farm life of the past. Small livestock animals are in the stables or roam freely on the farm.

Name: Landgoed Verhildersum Leens
Description_Text:
Verhildersum Estate tells the story of the 19th-century Groningen countryside. The core of the estate is the 14th-century borg (stronghold), surrounded by a museum farm, orchard and garden.

Like a sparkling diamond, the 14th-century borg takes center stage. Throughout the centuries, the different families that lived in the borg changed it to suit their needs. Today, the stronghold tells the story of the Van Bolhuis-Frima family during the second half of the 19th century. It looks as if the inhabitants have just left and could be back any moment!

Estate
The estate also includes a laborer’s house dating back to 1888. The farm and coach house are where you’ll find the exhibitions, museum shop and museum café. The barn has been furnished in the style of a traditional Groningen barn in the 19th century. The orchard is home to over 100 fruit varieties, and the garden hosts sculptures by Eddy Roos.

Various events take place on the estate during high season.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Landhuis Oud Amelisweerd
Description_Text:
Landhuis Oud Amelisweerd, along with its Coach House and park, is one of the most remarkable national monuments in the Netherlands and is located just a stone's throw from Utrecht.

Because the house has never been intensively inhabited, many original elements have been preserved. A famous example is the unique hand-painted Chinese wallpaper from the 18th century. Today, you can visit exhibitions on art, science, and history.

Landhuis Oud Amelisweerd is a nexus where people, nature, art and history meet. Come see the amazing Cabinet of Curiosities.

Name: Leudal Museum
Description_Text:
The municipality of Leudal in the province of Limburg is a treasure trove of culture, nature and history. See it all in the Leudal Museum. Discover the extraordinary archaeological finds and experience what everyday life was like in Limburg. Learn what it was like to live in Leudal during the Second World War through unique photos, maps and other objects.

The permanent collection is divided into four separate areas of interest: Flora and fauna, archaeology, local heritage and history. The museum has displays of a wide range of objects, photos and documents. The Leudal Museum also puts on various activities in and around the museum. In short, a fun and informative experience for the entire family, with a Limburg touch.

Name: Liemers Museum
Description_Text:
The Liemers Museum is finally open again! The fully renovated regional museum tells the story of the past, present and future of the region’s people.

Look around and discover the history of the region in a contemporary presentation where objects of the museum come to you. Find your way along the timeline starting near the entrance and continuing on the upper floor. The history is presented in stories from the hunters and gatherers in the Stone Age to the current residents of the Liemers region. The Liemers Museum offers a palette of history the entire family will enjoy.

Aside from its permanent exhibition, the Liemers Museum also regularly sets up temporary exhibitions on a variety of artists.

Name: Limburgs Museum
Description_Text:
The museum collects, displays and tells the stories of Limburg. Discover surprising perspectives on the past, present and future of Limburg and the world around us.

Culture and history in Limburg
Limburg is a remarkable province. This is where the first humans in what is now the Netherlands settled, followed by early farmers. This is where the Romans entered this country, where the first Christians lived and where the first cities developed.

Aside from this rich history, the museum also illustrates the Limburg of today. An international province at the center of European development.

The Limburgs Museum is at the center of society. The museum strives for inclusive discourse with many different perspectives. The stories of Limburg will be made available in three ways: in the museum itself, on location and online.

Name: Literatuurmuseum / Kinderboekenmuseum
Description_Text:
The Museum of Literature/Children’s Book Museum holds the literary memories of the Netherlands. The archive includes books by nearly every Dutch author and illustrator. Come and wander among authors and their stories.

Museum of Literature
Come and wander among authors and their stories. The Museum of Literature offers access to writers’ worlds, with full displays on the work and lives of Dutch-language authors. From love letters to manuscripts. Online exhibitions tell stories big and small from literature, based on the collection. Wander through an enormous digital collection of portraits of writers and test your literary knowledge. The literatuurmuseum.nl website offers days of content, and is accessible 24/7!  Want to discover the Museum of Literature’s collection offline? Come and visit the Museum of Literature in The Hague.

Children’s Book Museum
Discover, experience and create the best stories at the Children’s Book Museum. Go on an adventure in the world of children’s books and your own fantasy world. Fun for children and adults alike.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Louwman Museum
Description_Text:
The automobile is one of the most important inventions of the 19th and 20th centuries. Check out the collection of more than 250 highlights at the Louwman Museum. Step into the history of progress.

The Louwman Museum in The Hague offers a visual depiction of more than 130 years of progress, innovation and design, in a unique collection of more than 250 highlights of automotive history.

Guided tour
Guided tours
From James Bond’s Aston Martin DB5 to the first Toyota ever built. During the tour, your guide will tell you all about the collection. Tours are available in Dutch, English or German, for both groups and individuals. You can book three different types of guided tour:

The history of the automobile (at least 60 minutes)
This guided tour on the upper floor covers the history of automobiles, starting with the first cars ever built. The most important developments and milestones in automotive history will be discussed in depth.

Racing, art and design (at least 60 minutes)
This guided tour on the second floor goes into the stories of artists that were inspired by the automobile and created the most beautiful, wide variety of posters, leaflets, paintings and sculptures. Furthermore, this tour will pass by the most exquisite race and show cars.

Luxurious automobiles and Dutch heritage (at least 60 minutes)
This guided tour on the first floor starts with the so-called ‘Great Cars’, cars owned by the richest people of the 1930s. The guide will then share some unique Dutch heritage: the largest collection of Spyker cars, as well as the sole remaining car built by Eysink.

You can explore the Louwman Museum at home via the audio tour. Discover the history of the automobile via IZI-travel or Spotify. Louwman Museum audio tour
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Luchtvaartmuseum Aviodrome
Description_Text:
Join us on a flight through the fascinating history of aviation. From hot air balloons to triplanes and fighter jets. See them all at the Aviodrome aircraft theme park. Experience exciting educational aviation stories and adventures!

Now boarding
Welcome to the Aviodrome aircraft theme park, where you can experience the most exciting and educational aviation stories and adventures, set out in over 6,000 m2. Jump on board a Boeing 747 jumbo jet and make-believe you’re piloting the plane. In the playground, children can learn how baggage handling works at an airport. No doubt about it: at Aviodrome, time flies!
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Luther Museum Amsterdam
Description_Text:
The Lutheran Museum Amsterdam is located in the Wittenberg building on the Nieuwe Keizersgracht. The museum shows how a religious community made a new start, with their own set of beliefs and a great deal of care for their fellows.

The poor
The building played an important part in care for the poor, elderly and orphans. The main item of heritage is the building itself with its governors’ chambers, corridor and church hall. The collection of heritage items includes paintings by Breenbergh and Ruysdael, silverware and authentic furniture.

Museum tour
Visitors start at the governors’ chamber, designed in the 18th century by Jacob Otten Husley. The governors managed the diaconate care home from this room. The tour continues at the Administration room, where you hear stories of Maarten Luther and the Word in relation to the paintings and many Bibles in the museum’s collection.

Linen room
Adjacent is the Linen room, which is connected to the Lady governor’s salon. Linen was one of the most precious goods of a house. The room that once housed linen now displays the dinner silverware, exquisite pieces produced in Amsterdam and other Lutheran communities such as Doesburg, Zierikzee and Leiden. The oldest items data back to the 17th century. The information in the Lady governor’s room focuses on the important role played by women in this house and church.

Corridor and Church hall
The corridor exhibits the timeline up to the current Diaconate, caring for the poor, elderly, undocumented and members of the LGBTQIA+ community. The impressive church hall often houses exhibitions, events and concerts.

Name: MU Hybrid Art House
Description_Text:
What is art, and what can it be? MU, housed in a former Philips factory, launches and presents new art, and creates a secondary program around it, aimed at a broad audience.

What is art?
MU is an exploratory presentation platform amid a rich international network of creators, who come together to define the liminal space between what art is and what it can be. MU mainly launches, produces and presents new work and surrounds it with an expansive, interdisciplinary program aimed at a broad and primarily young audience. Central to this are understanding and knowledge of, as well as familiarity and experience with, the creation of art.

Discover
MU is eager for talent, and challenges it to be eager. MU stimulates the artistic research and development of artists and designers and helps them position themselves internationally.

Name: Maas Binnenvaartmuseum
Description_Text:
The largest inland harbor of the Netherlands is far removed from the oceans and industrial cities. Discover the rich history of the Meuse river and inland navigation in Maasbracht. Learn all about it at this center for inland navigation.

Economic activity
The Maasboulevard (Meuse boulevard) along the port is bustling with economic activity related to inland navigation or boating. Discover the many stories and memories about inland navigation in Maasbracht at the Maas Binnenvaartmuseum (Meuse inland navigation museum).

Name: Marechausseemuseum
Description_Text:
From December 23, 2023, the museum of the  Royal Netherlands Marechaussee will be closed. At the end of 2024, the story of the Marechaussee gets a place in the National Military Museum in Soesterberg.

Militaries in civil society
The Royal Netherlands Marechaussee is one of the four branches of the Netherlands Armed Forces often working within civil society. The Marechaussee operate as the border police, and also protect VIPs and certain properties. Alongside international and military tasks the Marechaussee assists the police in case of, for example, a terrorist threat or as part of a specialized investigation team. Learn more about the tasks of this special branch of the Netherlands Armed Forces at the Marechausseemuseum.

Historical perspective
Located in a former orphanage, the Marechausseemuseum is where you can delve into the history of the Royal Netherlands Marechaussee from when it was founded in 1814 to its worldwide deployment of today. Come see the weapons, uniforms and vehicles and more.

Stories
Learn more about the tasks of the Royal Netherlands Marechaussee at four exhibitions. Learn about the current tasks of the Marechaussee at the I pledge allegiance to the King exhibition where 6 contemporary members speak about moving from civil society to the armed forces. How has it affected them and their environment? The Side by side exhibition focuses on the 40-year anniversary of women joining the Royal Netherlands Marechaussee and the personal experience of female Marechaussee members working in what is often considered to be a man’s world.

Memento Mori
Memento Mori is a remembrance room, where we commemorate the sacrifices that the men and women of the Marechaussee have made and continue to make to maintain peace and security in the Netherlands.

Name: Marie Tak van Poortvliet Museum
Description_Text:
The Marie Tak van Poortvliet Museum Domburg takes its name from art collector, anthroposophist and agricultural pioneer Marie Tak van Poortvliet (1871-1936), who had a villa built in Domburg in the early 20th century.

Seaside culture
Seaside towns seem to be magnets for artists. In Domburg, this effect was enhanced by the natural beauty of the surroundings, the special light by the sea and its reflection, which can be seen even at Walcheren. The capricious dune landscape, the ever-changing North Sea and the ancient forests around the town have inspired many poets, composers, writers, and most of all, painters. Around 1900, when artist Jan Toorop (1858-1928) first arrived in Domburg, the local population was already familiar with a bathing season and an established seaside culture . The collection includes works by Jan Toorop and reproductions of paintings by Piet Mondrian.
Facilities: Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Marinemuseum
Description_Text:
Are you brave enough to climb through the hatch and experience life on board a submarine? The Navy Museum in Den Helder is the place to really experience the navy.

Discover the history of the Royal Netherlands Navy, check out the armaments and uniforms, and learn all about the development of naval technology.

The Tonijn submarine
Experience the navy both at sea and underwater. The Tonijn submarine is a unique experience: the only such vessel open to the public in the Netherlands. The Tonijn is still in its original condition and former sailors tell you exciting stories about life on board.

500 years of history
Travel through 500 years of naval history at the Navy Museum. Check out ship models, armaments and uniforms. Listen to stories told by former sailors and learn about the technology used in the navy.

Name: Mariniersmuseum
Description_Text:
Get to know the Netherlands Marine Corps, an elite unit that has existed since 1665. The museum mirrors the life of a marine: rugged, exciting, challenging and varied.

Marines are naval soldiers, deployed where the land meets
the sea. They carry out special operations all over the
globe. This is reflected by their motto Qua patet orbis (‘As far as the world extends’).

As well as learning more about current missions, you can also
dive into the history of the Netherlands Marine Corps. The Zeesoldaten (‘naval infantry’) exhibition tells
the story of this elite unit of the Royal Netherlands Navy,
from its founding by Michiel de Ruyter and Johan de Witt to the present day.

Want to take part? At the Marines Museum, you can!
At the Marines on a mission experience, you can find out
why marines need to be able to work together
under even the most extreme circumstances. Build your team and go on a mission.

The museum focuses on May 1940 . Interactive presentations offer insight into the marines’ role in the defense of Rotterdam prior to the bombing of the city on May 14, 1940.

A holiday program is offered during school holidays, and the temporary exhibitions are frequently renewed.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Maritiem Centrum "Abraham Fock"
Description_Text:
Navigate on the basis of the stars, a compass and the coastline. Participate in a rescue or become the captain of a ship. Maritiem Centrum Abraham Fock offers adventure for everyone.

Participate in a real-life rescue operation. Become a captain of a ship on a genuine bridge and take control, or use the radio room to communicate.

Horse-drawn lifeboat
The center is also home base for a horse-drawn lifeboat. Find out when the lifeboat demonstrations take place on the website of the Ameland museums.

Name: Maritiem Museum Rotterdam
Description_Text:
Salty sea dogs, fearless explorers and scary sea monsters. At the Maritime Museum, travel through the maritime past and present of the Netherlands via exhibitions for adventurers young and old alike.

Listen to stories of tough sailors, brave explorers, hard-working dock workers, maritime technicians or determined captains.

Search for new energy at sea in the 'Offshore Experience'.  In the ‘Offshore Experience’ you experience working on board a platform in the middle of the sea. Discover in the exhibition ‘Destination Port City’ how Rotterdam became a famous world port. At the new children's activity exhibition 'Plons! The future of the sea', young visitors are immersed in the fascinating (under)water world. The museum is located in the oldest and largest museum port in the Netherlands, where you can experience how the world port of Rotterdam started at this location on historic ships and cranes. Maritime Museum, a world that moves you!

strong text Booking a time slot is mandatory for the exhibition Plons! The future of the sea!**
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Maritiem Muzeeum Zeeland
Description_Text:
Listen to great stories in the Zeeland Maritime MuSEAum. Stories about heroes, victories and setbacks. About treasure and discoveries. Get to know the people whose lives are connected with the sea.

Treasure on the ocean floor
Listen to great stories in the Zeeland Maritime MuSEAum. Stories about heroes, victories and setbacks. About courage and creativity, treasures and discoveries. Stories from long ago up to the present day. Stories of the sea. Get to know the people whose lives are intertwined with the sea. Michiel de Ruyter, naturally, as well as other famous and lesser-known sailors.

At the MuSEAum, you can find underwater archaeology treasures taken from ships from the 17th century to the present day. Gold and silver coins, plates, cutlery, cups and bottles (with wine still in them!). Studying this treasure has taught us more about what life was like for the sailors. Step on board at the muSEAum. And don’t forget to visit the 17th-century turret: it offers a fabulous view of the sea and the city.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Marius van Dokkum Museum
Description_Text:
The paintings on display at the Marius van Dokkum Museum in Harderwijk often have an element of humor. Van Dokkum’s work often features ordinary people in their own environments.

Amusing
The work of Marius van Dokkum (born 1957) consists of portraits, still lifes and free subject paintings. His free subject paintings often portray people in their own living environment. Despite their idiosyncrasies, these people are still likable. All the details are typical of Marius van Dokkum’s work. There’s so much to see! His paintings often have a funny side. Van Dokkum believes that humor makes art more accessible.

Anatomical theater
The Marius van Dokkum Museum in Harderwijk opened on 26 May 2018. It is housed in one of Harderwijk’s most striking buildings, the University of Harderwijk’s former anatomical theater. Professors of anatomy would teach their students during dissections. After a thorough renovation, this remarkable location was turned into a museum dedicated to the work of a living artist.

Name: Marker Museum
Description_Text:
The Marker Museum is housed in six smokehouses. One of them is furnished as it would have been in 1932, which is when a family last lived there. The museum paints a picture of Marken through a rotating program of temporary exhibitions.

Traditionally, houses in Marken had “whitewashed” walls covered with signs and pictures, wooden boxes for traditional clothing items and elaborately decorated beds.

Temporary exhibitions
The museum paints a picture of Marken with temporary exhibitions and an audiovisual presentation. The museum displays a wide range of traditional costumes from Marken. Paintings by Reinier Peijnenburg (1884-1968) and works by painter Jan Moenis (1875-1953) from Marken are also on display.

Name: Markiezenhof
Description_Text:
The Markiezenhof is the most beautiful medieval city palace in western Europe. Two museums are located inside the palace: a museum on the city and its surroundings, and the Carnival Museum. Go on an adventure in this sprawling palace!

A rich history
The Markiezenhof is inextricably linked to the rich history of the lords and marquises of Bergen op Zoom. Go on an adventure in the many rooms, galleries, staircase towers, courtyards and gardens of this sprawling palace and explore the history of the city and its surroundings.

Carnival Museum
The second floor of the palace hosts an exhibition on the history of fairs and carnivals! With parts and miniatures of the fairground rides of yesteryear, it’s a lot of fun for children.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Marres, Huis voor Hedendaagse Kunst
Description_Text:
Marres is researching visual arts in the broadest sense of the word, through exhibitions, lectures, performances and publications. Roam the rooms of the historic house and explore the courtyard.

Sensory vocabulary
Marres, House for Contemporary Culture, is located in the center of the old city of Maastricht. At Marres, visual artists, musicians, designers, cooks and perfumers are developing a new sensory vocabulary. Other than the dynamic program featuring exhibitions, presentations and performances, Marres also has a beautiful courtyard and a much-loved restaurant.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Mauritshuis
Description_Text:
Discover the best 17th-century Dutch paintings at the Mauritshuis. Admire masterpieces such as Vermeer’s Girl with a Pearl Earring and Rembrandt’s The Anatomy Lesson of Dr. Nicolaes Tulp , in intimate galleries.

The Mauritshuis displays the world’s best Dutch and Flemish Old Masters from the times of Rembrandt and Vermeer. The intimate galleries showcase over 200 masterpieces. For example, Vermeer’s Girl with a Pearl Earring and Rembrandt’s The Anatomy Lesson of Dr. Nicolaes Tulp . The masterpieces are backed up by a multimedia tour.

A delightful environment
The delightful environment of this charming 17th-century museum includes damask wallpapers, glittering chandeliers and monumental ceiling paintings. The well-lit underground foyer houses a brasserie and the museum shop. The Art Deco-style wing hosts temporary exhibitions and an artists’ studio.
Facilities: Museumwinkel, Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Miramar Zeemuseum
Description_Text:
The province of Drenthe is the province of forests and moors and of the sea museum, Miramar Zeemuseum. Jeanne Warners’ collection of sea curiosities found a home in Miramar. Here you will find all manner of oddities from the sea, from shells and chitons to starfish and flying fish.

Treasures from the sea
In the spring of 1955, Jeanne Warner found a small, elegant, spiked shell on one of the Balearic Islands. This shell sparked her curiosity, and eventually inspired Jeanne’s life purpose: a sea museum. Miramar has an impressive collection of sea treasures. Shells, starfish, sponges, corals, chitons, flying fish and much more can be found in this museum. Warners’ first shell and the trunks she used to transport her finds are also on display at the museum.

Miramar often hosts temporary exhibitions on subjects related to the sea.
Facilities: Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Missiemuseum Steyl
Description_Text:
The Mission Museum illustrates how missionaries of the past saw the world.
Like opening a time capsule from the past, a visit here will change your view of the world.

Its collection is a treasure trove of pieces obtained by missionaries working all over the world. The unique arrangement of the collection in its towering display cases has remained unchanged since 1934. Inspiring, authentic, and brimming with history, including famous and lesser-known stories. Like opening a time capsule from the past, a visit here will change your view of the world.

Name: Molenmuseum
Description_Text:
The Mill Museum’s former location closed on June 3, 2019. In mid-2020, Mill Museum De Kalverliefde reopened at Kalverringdijk 30, Zaanse Schans.

The Mill Museum is managed by the De Zaansche Molen foundation. De Zaansche Molen also manages 13 other industrial mills that remain in operation. The Mill Museum explains the rise and fall of the milling industry from 1597 to date.

The Mill Museum
The Mill Museum, opened by Prince Consort Hendrik in 1928, displays a wide range of items related to the glory days of milling. Ranging from a copper tobacco box to the key to a mill; from a scale model to an old coffee pot.

Het Molenpanorama (The panorama of mills)
One of the museum’s highlights is Het Molenpanorama (The panorama of mills), painted by Frans Mars (co-founder of the De Zaansche Molen foundation) during World War II. The painting gives an impression of the eastern bank of the river Zaan circa 1800, as seen from Koog aan de Zaan’s former town hall.

A new location from mid-2020
The museum relocated in 2019. In mid-2020, Mill Museum De Kalverliefde reopened at Kalverringdijk 30, Zaanse Schans.

Name: Molenmuseum De Valk
Description_Text:
Molenmuseum De Valk is housed in a seven-floor tower mill. The ground floor houses the only remaining town miller’s residence in the Netherlands, with furnishings dating from circa 1900.

Molenmuseum De Valk is housed in a seven-floor tower mill dating from 1743. On the ground floor, the only remaining town miller’s residence in the Netherlands has been kept largely intact. Nineteen windmills once stood on Leiden’s walls, but only De Valk remains.

In the miller’s home
The interior of the last miller’s living room dates back to circa 1900. The attics, once used for sleeping and storage, now house exhibitions on the history and technology of flour mills like De Valk.  The mill itself begins at the frame floor level. This floor contains the original grinding mechanism, which is still used from time to time.

Name: Mondriaanhuis
Description_Text:
Immerse yourself in Piet Mondrian’s dynamic life and see the world through his eyes. See his early works, his recreated Parisian studio and the DIY-studio where you can try your hand yourself.

The Mondriaanhuis in Amersfoort is the birthplace of artist Piet Mondrian. Here you can discover how he gradually transitioned from realistic landscapes to abstract compositions made up of characteristic lines and shapes.

Victory Boogie Woogie
Experience Mondrian’s artistic evolution through video installations and follow his search in New York that led him to the creation of his magnum opus, Victory Boogie Woogie. See Mondrian’s early work and a replica of his atelier in Paris.

Name: Multatuli Museum
Description_Text:
The Multatuli Museum is keeping the memory of Eduard Douwes Dekker alive. Better known by his pseudonym, Multaltuli, the author’s personal belongings, such as his desk, globe and book cabinet containing his library can all be viewed here.

Max Havelaar
The Multatuli museum is located in the birthplace of Eduard Douwes Dekker (1820-1887), who wrote his most famous novel Max Havelaar under the pseudonym Multatuli. In the Max Havelaar, Multatuli denounced the Dutch government for their exploitation of the population and other abuses in the the former Dutch kolonies of the East Indies, which he witnessed as a civil servant. The book is still considered as one of the most important 'whistleblower' novels in Dutch literary history. For the first time, everyone could read about the seriousness of the situation in the colonies and, especially at the beginning of the 20th century, this fuelled resistance to colonialism. Even in his later work, Multatuli continued to campaign for the rights of minority groups. He made ardent pleas for the emancipation and suffrage of women and campaigned for workers' rights.

Workplace
The Multatuli museum houses Multatuli's workplace, furniture and books. Choose a guided tour by one of the tour guides or take your time to study the library. Learn more about the history of the Netherlands and Indonesia at the time of Multatuli's stay, and get to know the author's multifaceted work and his personal life.

Name: Museon-Omniversum
Description_Text:
At One Planet, it’s all about the Earth, humanity and sustainable development. Marvel at the beauty of our planet in One Planet Dome . Discover the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals in the interactive One Planet Expo . And discover creative solutions for the future in One Planet NOW! , where you too can take action.
One Planet is an initiative of the Museon-Omniversum.

One Planet - The future is here!
At One Planet, it’s all about the Earth, humanity and sustainable development. Marvel at the beauty of our planet in One Planet Dome. Learn all there is to know about the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals in the interactive One Planet Expo. And discover creative solutions for the future in One Planet NOW!, where you too can take action.

One Planet Dome
In One Planet Dome, you can see how beautiful planet Earth truly is. Watch breathtaking, widescreen movies about nature, culture and science in the only dome theater in the Benelux. The screen has the shape of half a dome and is half the size of a soccer field. Immerse yourself, surrounded by moving films. The superb sound system adds to this experience.

One Planet Expo
Find out about the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals in the interactive One Planet Expo . The UN intends to achieve these goals by 2030, to make the world a better place. Learn more about the various goals through games, artifacts, images and text. Answer thought-provoking questions and discover what kind of global citizen you are.

One Planet NOW!
In the dynamic One Planet NOW! , discover smart solutions for a sustainable future. Encouraging innovations that will make the world a fairer place and keep it habitable. One Planet NOW! consists of several zones, such as Exercise Square , the Construction Site and the Future Food Lab . Designers, researchers and entrepreneurs tell you more about their creative initiatives on topics that have become part of our everyday lives, such as sustainable shopping, planet-proof cooking and bio-based construction. Look around a ‘tiny house’, attend a workshop or join the debate at the Clubhouse. There’s always lots to do, for young and old alike. One Planet is an initiative of the Museon-Omniversum.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum 'De Roos'
Description_Text:
Behind a 16th-century façade at Markt 46, you will find Museum De Roos. Learn about one of the first places to be granted city rights in the Netherlands, in 1213.

Old fortified city
Museum De Roost is largely devoted to the history of Geertruidenberg – the first place to receive city rights in the Netherlands, in 1213. Prints, scale models and charters show the development of the oldest fortified city of the Netherlands. There is a 14th-century sword on display, and you can learn more about Vice-Admiral Zoutman, the poet Juliana de Lannoy and three famous painters from the Bergen School.

Name: Museum 'De Tien Malen'
Description_Text:
Regional agriculture in the Putten area. At Museum De Tien Malen visitors look back in time and discover how people used, influenced and managed the land in and around Putten: village greens, land fertilized using manure and sods, and uncultivated land and the farmers who had the legal hereditary right to use this land.

Putten
What is the origin of the term malen ? Putten dates back to 855, when it consisted of hamlets and ‘maalschappen’ owning uncultivated land from which members could take sods to fertilize the cultivated land. The most important members of the hamlets met once a year to discuss their common affairs. The museum tells the history of Putten based on archaeological finds.

Name: Museum 't Behouden Huys
Description_Text:
Museum ’t Behouden Huys is the treasure trove of Terschelling. Find out more about forgotten events, Willem Barentsz, folktales, fairy tales and sagas of Terschelling and Jauk Haan and the seven mermaids.

Treasury of Terschelling
Come be amazed by the culture and history of Terschelling at Museum ’t Behouden Huys. Walk in and meet Minister Grevensteijn, who was at the Great Fire of 1666 and tells his story. Then venture into the attic for stories of long-forgotten events. Learn more about Willem Barentsz.

Name: Museum Abdijkerk
Description_Text:
For over 800 years, Thorn was ruled by noble women. The white city’s gothic abbey church, which is still in use, tells the story of these nobles.

The eastern crypt is home to relics as well as a famous mummy. The ladies’ choir and chapter room house the church treasures. To get the most from your visit, start at museum Het Land van Thorn. The museum offers combined tickets for both the museum and the abbey church, as well as a free audio tour of the art treasures on display.

Name: Museum Arnhem
Description_Text:
Examining art in one of the most beautifully located museums in the Netherlands, with a stunning view of the Rhine. This is what Museum Arnhem has to offer. The museum reopened its doors in May 2022 following large-scale renovation. A renovated museum in a familiar location, with a sculpture garden open to all.

New wing
Starting at the welcoming dome, discover the new wing designed by Benthem Crouwel Architects and the collection of contemporary magic realism and neorealism art and design. The museum connects art and society from various perspectives. Visitor favorites such as Carel Willink and Pyke Koch, as well as the contemporary art of Otobong Nkanga and Marlene Dumas are back on display.

Sculpture garden
The Museum Arnhem garden is a great place to play table tennis or enjoy a cup of coffee overlooking the Rhine. The garden features sculptures by Maria Roosen, Louie Cordero, Monika Dahlberg, Henry Moore, and many others.

Name: Museum Batavialand
Description_Text:
At Museum Batavialand you dive into hidden stories with three unique experiences: step aboard the reconstruction of the VOC ship Batavia, discover historic crafts at the shipyard and delve into the history of Flevoland in our exhibit hall. All included in one ticket!

The shipyard
Step into the world of pioneer Willem Vos and see how his dream to build a VOC ship was realized. Watch and learn how a large wooden ship was built 400 years ago. Learn about traditional craftsmanship and try it out for yourself: rope making, nail making, walking on stilts, ring throwing or chiseling. Travel to the 17th century as you listen to our guides’ wonderful, exciting and funny stories.

The museum
At the museum, pioneer Cornelis Lely will tell you more about the history of the polders. Walk the length of the Flevowand embroidery and learn about the history of life along the Zuiderzee from the Ice Age to the present day. Join Michelle and travel to prehistoric times in “Het land van Michelle” (Michelle’s Land). Watch the film to see what the Flevoland landscape looked like 7,000 years ago. Get ready to work sailing a cog ship or becoming an engineer in the Water Theater making your own polder.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum Beelden aan Zee
Description_Text:
Museum Beelden aan Zee is perfect for fans of sculpture. You will find beautiful sculptures both inside and outside the museum. The permanent collections focus on contemporary sculptures of people.

Sculptures
At this seaside sculpture museum, the styles vary widely, as do the media used. From bronze and wood to iron and plastic. Exhibitions of other work take place on a regular basis, focusing on a single sculptor or a group.

Fairytales and legends
The boulevard fairytale garden takes in fables and legends of the sea. The largest sculpture, De Haringeter , The Herring Eater, is no less than 12 meters tall.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum Belvédère
Description_Text:
Museum Belvédère is the museum for modern and contemporary paintings from the Northern Netherlands. The exhibits also include art by national and international contemporaries and kindred spirits.

Dream
In the 1950s three friends dreamed of their own museum for modern art: Boele Bregman, Sjoerd de Vries and Thom Mercuur. Some 40 years later, their dream came true. Museum Belvédère is the first museum for modern and contemporary art in Friesland.

Jan Mankes and Thijs Rinsema
The museum exhibits works of art by relevant Frisian painters such as Jan Mankes, Thijs Rinsema, Tames Oud, Gerrit Benner, Boele Bregman, Willem van Althuis and Sjoerd de Vries, but also work by kindred spirits from other parts of the Netherlands and abroad.

Name: Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen
Description_Text:
Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen is closed until 2029 for renovations. You can see the collection at Depot Boijmans Van Beuningen and in exhibitions in the Netherlands and around the world.

Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen is a versatile and unique museum in the heart of the port city of Rotterdam.

Collectors
Be amazed by the wealth and versatility of the collection, the result of the passion of 1,700 private collectors. They have donated no fewer than 50,000 objets d’art over the nearly 170 years of the museum’s existence.
Facilities: Museumwinkel, Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Museum Boxtel
Description_Text:
See and experience Boxtel at Museum Boxtel (MUBO). MUBO is a unique museum; it is the only museum that focuses on the history of Boxtel from prehistoric to modern times and exhibits the Canon of Boxtel.

The museum houses the permanent Canon of Boxtel exhibition and five temporary exhibitions throughout the year.

Name: Museum Bredius
Description_Text:
When Dutch art collector Abraham Bredius passed away, he bequeathed his collection to the municipality of The Hague. His house was, and still is, a museum.

Who was Abraham Bredius?
Abraham Bredius was a Dutch art historian and art collector. When he died, he left his entire collection to the municipality of The Hague. His house had already been turned into a museum after he emigrated to Monaco in 1924. Until 1985, his collection of paintings, drawings, antique furniture, silverware, crystalware and porcelain was open to the public.

A new life for Bredius
After the museum closed in 1985, the collection was moved to a depot. Fortunately, Museum Bredius was able to re-open its doors in 1990 thanks to the efforts of art enthusiasts.

Name: Museum BroekerVeiling
Description_Text:
The BroekerVeiling, in the Geestmerambacht polder in the province of North Holland, was the first and last sail-through vegetable auction in the world. It’s been a unique museum since 1973. See how vegetables used to be auctioned here.

The sail-through auction house
Discover the story of an area that was once made up of over 15,000 islands. The first and last sail-through vegetable auction house in the world was located among these islands. In 1973, it became a museum. Go back in time with gardener Arie and learn how the produce was auctioned. If you like, you can sail through the remains of the Realm of a Thousand Islands. Or be inspired by the various exhibitions.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum Bronbeek
Description_Text:
Museum Bronbeek focuses on Dutch colonialism in Indonesia, especially the KNIL (Royal Netherlands East Indies Army).

Colonial history
Museum Bronbeek takes you back to the Dutch colonial past. It presents the history of the KNIL (Royal Netherlands East Indies Army) and the colonized. The story begins in the 16th century, then continues through the Second World War and culminates in the post-colonial period. Stories from eyewitnesses, authentic uniforms, weapons and videos paint the historical picture.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum Bussemakerhuis
Description_Text:
The only remaining linen trading house in the Netherlands, in virtually original condition. Museum Bussemakerhuis offers a glimpse into the history of linen in Borne (Twente).

Visitors at Museum Bussemakerhuis can learn out about the history of linen in Borne. The house presents a look at the textile industry in Twente, specifically the rich history of linen in Borne in the 18th and 19th centuries. Visit the permanent exhibition to learn more about the relevance of linen today. You will also learn about the linen trade in Twente in the past and the connection between the Mennonites of the Netherlands and the linen trade.

Name: Museum Buurt Spoorweg
Description_Text:
Experience train travel like our forebears did. Museum Buurtspoorweg brings the past to life. Enjoy the train experience of yesteryear: travel in style on a steam train between Haaksbergen and Boekelo.

Museum Buurtspoorweg has seven steam locomotives, eight diesel locomotives, renovated train cars and a large collection of historic freight stock. The trains do not run daily. Check the museum website for the current schedule.

Haaksbergen Station
Haaksbergen station is the main location. Come visit the original train station dating from 1884, the railway workshop and motive power depot. There are two other train stations, Zoutindustrie and Boekelo which includes the museum depot.
Facilities: Museumwinkel, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Museum Catharijneconvent
Description_Text:
Museum Catharijneconvent is housed in an atmospheric medieval convent in the heart of Utrecht. The museum collection tells the story of the artistic and cultural history of Christianity in the Netherlands.

Visit the national museum of Christian art, culture and history. With its collection of objects from both Protestant and Catholic artefacts, this museum is unique in the world. Fascinating exhibitions are organized throughout the year. The permanent collection is definitely worth a visit.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum Cobra
Description_Text:
During the mid-20th century, the Cobra movement (1948-1951) helped modern art break through in the Netherlands. The Cobra Museum is the place to see the great works of this movement.

Experiment & expression
Experiment and expression in art are emphasized in the spirit of the Cobra movement at the museum. It owns a large Cobra art collection and documentary material that is continuously being expanded and used for various exhibitions. The museum is an international expertise center regarding the Cobra heritage, and it conducts research and advises other museums.

Crossroads of society and art
The Cobra Museum of Modern Art in Amstelveen was founded in 1995. It makes the heritage of the Cobra movement available to the public and keeps the ideas of the artists involved with the movement alive. The ideas and visions of the Cobra movement go beyond the artworks and poetry it produced. The attitude towards work of the Cobra artists is still relevant today. They were looking for a connection between art and the people. They were vocal about the direction society was taking. They worked together, inspired each other and generated more impact together than they ever could have individually.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum Collectie Brands
Description_Text:
Imagine a place where wonder lurks around every corner and your curiosity is piqued. Museum Collectie Brands in Nieuw-Dordrecht is a true treasure trove filled with fascinating objects and stories waiting to be discovered.

A surprise around every corner With an extensive collection of historical objects, works of art and memorabilia, this museum offers a fascinating insight into the history of the region and far beyond. From antique objects from grandmother's time to fine paintings and rare artefacts, you will discover a unique story in every corner of the museum.

An enchanting journey Walk through the museum and be taken on a journey to times gone by, coming face to face with intriguing objects and interesting exhibits. Whether you are a history enthusiast or just looking for a fascinating cultural experience, Museum Collectie Brands has something for everyone.

Enrich your senses Be surprised by the diversity and beauty of the collection, and lose yourself in the magic of discovery. Whether you come alone, with friends or with family, a visit to Museum Collectie Brands is an unforgettable experience that will broaden your horizons and enrich your knowledge. Come along and immerse yourself in the wonderful world of this extraordinary museum!
Facilities: Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum Collectie Krop
Description_Text:
In 1956, Hildo Krop became the honorary city sculptor of Amsterdam. The city is filled with his artwork. Museum Hildo Krop houses a unique collection.

Museum Hildo Krop forms part of the Instituut Collectie Krop, housed in the villa Rams Woerthe in Steenwijk. The museum houses unique artwork by the sculptor Hildo Krop.

Who was Hildo Krop?
Hildo Krop attended the Rijksakademie van beeldende kunsten (state academy of fine arts). After he graduated, he quickly started to make a name for himself. For 40 years, he worked for the city of Amsterdam. In 1956, he was granted the honorary title of city sculptor of Amsterdam .  The museum displays art produced by this well-known sculptor.

Name: Museum De Bastei
Description_Text:
De Bastei tells the story of life in, around and on the river. Visit the oldest city in the Netherlands to experience the past, discover the fascinating flora and fauna in Gelderland (the Rhine-Meuse Delta) and set to work at this fortification on the river Waal. A place for researchers young and old alike to learn and have fun.

Discover the secrets of De Bastei
At De Bastei, find out all about the relationship between people and rivers over time. Discover how Nijmegen was shaped by its strategic position on the river Waal. Learn about 2000 years of building along the river. Visit underground corridors where the ruins of Roman walls, medieval city castles and the 16th-century fortification (Bastei) itself tell the story of people living there in the past.

Travel further back in time and come face to face with one of our highlights: a mammoth skull found at Bergharen. You can also see the current flora and fauna of Nijmegen and the Gelderse Poort nature reserve. As you’ll see, there’s a lot more life in and around the city than you might think!

Name: Museum De Dorpsdokter
Description_Text: Learn all about primary care at Museum de Dorpsdokter (Village physician’s museum). The upper floor houses the exhibition Brabantse dokters (Brabantian physicians). Discover the collection Geschiedenis van Hilvarenbeek (history of Hilvarenbeek) at the Beekse Toren.

Name: Museum De Koperen Knop
Description_Text:
In and around a 17th-century farm, Museum De Koperen Knop (the copper button) illustrates the history of the Alblasserwaard region. The museum hosts unique temporary exhibitions.

In and around this historic building, we illustrate the history of the Alblasserwaard region. The museum consists of a main building, a smithy, a workshop producing hoops, and an extensive garden. The front house is furnished as a stately farmhouse, with a kitchen, a root cellar, parlor, drawing room, rentier’s room, library and reading room.

A variety of styles
Various styles in one place. Examine a beautiful collection of tiles in the entrance hall or the area between the homestead and the stables. The barn has been converted into a modern exhibition hall, focusing on art and history. Behind the farm is an extensive garden with an orchard and pollard willows. Between April 1 and October 1, the garden serves as a tea garden. The museum also has a café.

Name: Museum De Lakenhal
Description_Text:
Museum De Lakenhal is the museum of the visual arts, applied arts and the history of the city of Leiden. Discover the city’s illustrious past in seven exhibitions.

Classic yet contemporary
Just like the city itself, the museum combines a classic appearance with a contemporary and unique character. Our comprehensive collection ranges from highlights of historic art such as Lucas van Leyden’s The Last Judgement and modern classics of the De Stijl movement to contemporary art by Claudy Jongstra, the Atelier van Lieshout and others. The varied exhibitions also illustrate the city’s eventful history.

Name: Museum De Waag
Description_Text:
The iconic Museum De Waag (weigh house), located on the centuries-old Brink market square in the city of Deventer, is located in one of the oldest weigh houses in the Netherlands. Experience the rich history of this important Hanseatic city.

A Hanseatic city
Museum De Waag is a great place to find out more about Deventer, one of the oldest cities in the Netherlands. Explore the rich history of this fortified market town and industrial city, from the museum main exhibits.

Audio tour and city walks
A Dutch-language audio tour is available at the museum and will give you extra information on the exhibition. Take a walk through the city center, guided by the 3Deventer app. This walk connects the exhibition to the many of the historic sights of Deventer.
Facilities: Museumwinkel, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Museum De Wemme
Description_Text:
Museum De Wemme hosts a new cultural history exhibition every year. The permanent exhibition consists of a large collection of handcarts.

Museum De Wemme, the regional cultural history and handcart museum in Zuidwolde, is a small museum, renovated beautifully in 2021.

Exhibitions
The museum houses a new exhibition every year. The 2022 exhibition, Je kunt de pot op (figurative meaning ‘get lost’, but literally ‘you can do your business in the pot’) is a retrospective of the history of the toilet. It starts with those used by the people who built the early Neolithic structures ends with very modern contemporary toilets. The following themes are addressed along the way: What happens to our stool , How do we relieve ourselves on the road and What did people use to wipe their behinds through time ?

Great relevance
For many it is difficult to talk about the topic, even though we do it daily. It is useful to think about it because good sanitary facilities are relevant to our health.

Will you join me in my travels?
The museum manages their unique collection of handcarts and exhibits a number of them every year. This year the museum exhibits handcarts selected based on the Health theme. Walk in the orchard and enjoy works of art by Adje Martens. Tin-Art is a decorative tin works located next to the museum. It is one of the last operating tin casting works in the Netherlands and presents a rotating collection of jewelry and other items. The museum is also a Tourist Information Point (TIP).
Facilities: Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum De Wieger
Description_Text:
Museum De Wieger was once the residence of painter and physician Hendrik Wiegersma. Aside from work by Wiegersma and contemporaries such as Charley Toorop and Leo Gestel, the museum also displays contemporary art.

The building that houses Museum De Wieger used to be Hendrik Wiegersma’s (1891-1969) residence, clinic and workshop. The residence offers a view on Hendrik Wiegersma’s life and work. Museum De Wieger also hosts exhibitions that fit in with the museum’s own collection. The workshops house temporary exhibitions of contemporary artists, often from Deurne and its surroundings.

Interwar period
The collection’s main focus is the modern art of the interwar period and contains works by, among others, Hendrik Wiegersma, Jan Sluijters, Leo Gestel, Charley Toorop, Joep Nicolas and Else Berg.

Name: Museum De Zwarte Tulp
Description_Text:
Museum de Zwarte Tulp guides you through the fascinating history of flower bulbs. The museum’s exhibits focus on the long history of flower bulbs, from their export trade to the artists who have been inspired by these bulbous plants.

The history of the tulip
Dig into the past of the Dune and Bulb region. Learn more about the science behind the development of new tulip varieties and discover how farmers worked a century ago. Exhibits celebrate artists who were inspired by flowers. The museum frequently organizes special activities for children.

Name: Museum Dokkum
Description_Text:
Museum Dokkum showcases 2000 years of culture in the northeast of Friesland. The permanent exhibition on Boniface paints a unique picture of the missionary that was murdered near Dokkum.

Museum Dokkum is housed in a number of historic buildings, including the 17th-century headquarters of the Admiralty of Friesland and Groningen. The museum owns an extensive collection of silverware. The former warehouse features a permanent exhibition on Boniface (circa 672-754). The exhibition paints a unique picture of the missionary murdered near Dokkum.

Highlights
One of the most special pieces in Museum Dokkum is a cup from the Dokkum bakers’ guild, made in 1613. A fascinating piece from the collection of samplers is a one from 1764, cross-stitched by the then 12-year-old Geesje Suidema.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum Dorestad
Description_Text:
Museum Dorestad is in the process of moving into the former town hall and is closed until further notice.

Discover the history of Wijk bij Duurstede, the site of the medieval trading hub of Dorestad. Dorestad was one of Europe’s most important trading hubs. The museum illustrates the history of Dorestad through objects excavated in Wijk bij Duurstede, as well as photos, drawings and scale models which complete the picture of the city.

Name: Museum Drachten
Description_Text:
With its remarkable collection of 20th-century visual art, Museum Dr8888 is a leading museum of modern art in the north of the Netherlands. Enjoy works of art by Theo van Doesburg, Kurt Schwitters and more.

Museum Dr8888
Museum Dr8888 is a museum for modern and contemporary art in Drachten, Friesland. Its unique collection tells stories that should never be forgotten. It focuses on how in the early 20th century, the international avant-garde movement was brought to Drachten by Theo van Doesburg and the brothers Thijs and Evert Rinsema. The museum mainly displays art from the period between the First and Second World Wars, with a focus on the Dada and De Stijl movements, as well as works of art from the expressionist and The Hague School styles. The exhibits have a regional focus and draw connections with the here and now.

Museum residence Van Doesburg-Rinsema
At most museums, artworks are displayed hanging on the wall. In Drachten, art is part of the townscape, and you can even walk into the exhibits. Step inside this life-sized ‘painting’ dating from 1921; a complete residential home in De Stijl architecture. The Van Doesburg-Rinsemahuis has been fully restored, both inside and out, after extensive research into the historically correct colors and architecture, in line with the original philosophies of Theo van Doesburg, founder of the De Stijl movement.
Facilities: Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum Elburg
Description_Text:
The city of Elburg exudes a medieval atmosphere. Dive into history at Museum Elburg. The monastery buildings, Vischpoort, casemates and guardhouse are all part of the museum.

One of the most prominent buildings in Elburg is the 15th-century Agnieten Convent. Museum Elburg is located in these late Gothic buildings.

History
The museum has an extensive collection of historical objects connected to Elburg and its surroundings, organized around six themes. As well as the permanent collection, the museum also hosts temporary exhibitions on various topics, primarily relating to history and especially the history of art.

Middle Ages
Visitors can visit the former monastery including medieval double chapel. The view of the monastery from the monastery garden is stunning. The Vischpoort, casemates and guardhouse are part of the museum and are worth visiting. Much of medieval Elburg remains preserved. Many of the streets and alleys here exude a medieval atmosphere.

Name: Museum Engelandvaarders
Description_Text:
Museum Engelandvaarders (England sailers) tells the story of the people who escaped the occupied Netherlands during World War II and traveled to the United Kingdom to continue the fight.

Heroes overseas
Hundreds of Engelandvaarders (England sailers) used small, barely seaworthy boats or even canoes to escape to the United Kingdom. From there, they often continued to fight against Nazi Germany and Japan. The crossing was incredibly difficult. Many of them never made it. Those who did reach England often joined the British or Dutch military branches.

Who were these people, and what are their stories? Get to know the Engelandvaarders and their stories.

Name: Museum Flehite
Description_Text:
Museum Flehite focuses on the history of Amersfoort (from a miracle of the Virgin Mary to Eysink motorcycles). It is a house for art and history in the historic center of Amersfoort.

Museum Flehite: House for art and history in the historic center of Amersfoort. The museum is located in houses built into the city wall during the Late Middle Ages, and offers a wonderful taste of the city’s history. The museum holds art exhibitions of national and international art. Take a break to enjoy a bite to eat and a drink at the museum café.* A cultural outing to Museum Flehite can be combined with a visit to the city center to complete your day out.

Exhibitions
Alongside the permanent exhibition on the history of Amersfoort, the museum hosts temporary exhibitions on the history of art and culture. The museum scavenger hunt has been developed especially for children. Ask at the desk for more information. Exhibitions overview

Name: Museum Fort Pannerden
Description_Text:
Exciting, surprising and beautifully renovated. That’s Pannerden Fort. This New Dutch Water Line fort is hidden underground and is five floors tall. Come and see for yourself!

View
The view from the roof is spectacular. Where else can you see farther over the Waal, the Rhine and the Pannerden Canal than here at Doornenburg?

Experience
Visit Pannerden Fort, nestled in a river landscape, defying earth, water, air and fire. The fort has stood its ground against these elements for 150 years. Select one of the interactive programs and explore! Do you prefer to be active and adventurous or just relax? Want to explore indoors or outdoors? The fort has a treasure trove of exciting stories and experiences!

Name: Museum Giethoorn 't Olde Maat Uus
Description_Text:
Want to know what life used to be like in Giethoorn? Come to Museum Giethoorn ‘t Olde Maat Uus! Hear the personal stories of prominent residents about peat extraction and local traditions.

Start your visit to Giethoorn at Museum Giethoorn ’t Olde Maat Uus!
Want to know what life used to be like in Giethoorn? Come to Museum Giethoorn ‘t Olde Maat Uus! Personal stories of prominent residents on peat extraction and local traditions give you background information on the village. Only here can you explore an authentic Giethoorn farm, both inside and out. The fishermen’s cottage and the boat house reveal the simple life of people in this village, which is only fully accessible by boat. Enjoy the informative film and the museum shop and coffee corner. Children have enough to discover too!

Audio tour
The audio tour will provide interesting information on many of the displayed items. You will be provided with a Podcatcher at the entrance. This device is very easy to use. Aim your Podcatcher at the special information cards to start it automatically. The audio tour is available in English, Dutch, German and Chinese.
The entrance fee includes this audio tour.

Temporary exhibition
There are temporary exhibitions in the Hendrik Maat exhibition hall, named after the previous owner of the museum, who was born in this house.

Museum shop
Looking for a special gift or souvenir? Take your time rummaging through the nostalgic items in the museum shop and you might find just the thing!

Coffee corner
The self-service coffee corner includes coffee, tea and soft drinks. Sit down for a drink before or after visiting the museum and enjoy the authentic atmosphere of the museum farmhouse.

Name: Museum Goemanszorg
Description_Text:
At the Museumboerderij Goemanszorg (Goemanszorg Regional and Agricultural Museum), learn all about what life was like as a farmer before the mechanization of agriculture. Here you’ll find a furnished farmhouse, a barn shed with farming tools and equipment, and demonstration days. Fun for young and old alike.

Goemanszorg Regional and Agricultural Museum is located in a historic farm from the 17th century at the edge of a circular village named Dreischor.

Farmhouse
The residence is furnished in the style of a 1920s farmhouse, with a living room, closet-bed, an opkamer, as well as an authentic cellar and kitchen. Inside the barn you will find exhibits presenting the four central themes of the museum: the history of the island, flax farming, madder farming and Zeeland horses. Many agricultural tools and implements are stored upstairs in the barn, where you will also find a playroom for children.

Traditional dress in the region of Schouw
This farmhouse museum focuses on the traditional dress and regional dialect of the Schouw area. The farm is surrounded by flower and herb gardens and a fruit tree orchard. Marvel at the different kinds of carriages on display in the carriage house.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Museum Gouda
Description_Text:
Museum Gouda is located in a medieval guest house and tells the story of the city. Also visit the Treasury, an open depot containing thousands of artworks.

Museum Gouda displays the history of the beautiful city of Gouda. Experience what the city looked like in 1562 with the detailed interactive scale model. Discover 17th-century paintings of militia companies by artists such as Ferdinand Bol. Marvel at the world-famous 19th-and 20th-century Gouda artistic ceramics.

Treasury
The museum also holds 19th-century masterpieces by The Hague School. You can also visit the Treasury, an open depot containing thousands of artworks.
Facilities: Restaurant, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum Havezate Mensinge
Description_Text:
The authentic inventory of the Havezate Mensinge Museum in Roden reflects the long history of the manor and its residents.

Paintings and more
Family portraits from the 18th century are displayed alongside landscape paintings of the surroundings by Coenraad Kymell from around 1900. In the hallway, a pair of historic wall clocks - one from the province of Drenthe, dating from 1760, and the other from the province of Friesland, dating from 1850, mark the passing of time – even though it sometimes feels as if time stands still at Mensinge.

Name: Museum Heerenveen
Description_Text:
Museum Heerenveen is a unique, dual museum. Aside from marveling at the largest indoor model city in the Netherlands and 19th-century paintings, you can get to know church minister and freethinker Ferdinand Domela Nieuwenhuis.

The permanent collection illustrates all sides of Heerenveen’s development. With the largest indoor model city in the Netherlands, archaeological finds and 19th-century paintings. Get to know the grietmannen, historic mayors of Friesland as well as Ferdinand Domela Nieuwenhuis.

Minister and freethinker
Discover the world of one of the most fascinating people in recent Dutch history at the biographical museum of Ferdinand Domela Nieuwenhuis (1846-1919). This minister, freethinker and socialist strove for justice for all.

Name: Museum Helmond
Description_Text:
Castle treasures from the past, artistic treasures from the present. In Museum Helmond, old heroes walk hand in hand with contemporary masters. This all happens at two locations: the historic Helmond Castle and the (currently temporarily closed) modern Kunsthal.

Helmond Castle
At the largest water castle in the Netherlands, built at the behest of the Duke of Brabant, you can experience the story of this centuries-old castle. Over the centuries, the castle long acted as a chic residence for four noble families. Overlooking the town, this castle is now a museum where you can imagine playing a part in a remarkable history.

Kunsthal Helmond
The arts hall is just a stone’s throw from Museum Helmond. The museum hosts temporary exhibitions of international modern art. The museum holds exhibitions on a range of themes related to art, photography or human interest.

Name: Museum Hengelo
Description_Text:
Discover the history of the city at Museum Hengelo. What has been lost? What was retained? The museum tells the stories of the people of Hengelo, both the famous and the long forgotten.

Museum Hengelo presents the history of the city based on the stories of its people. It presents a unique view of history and how the city developed through time.

Name: Museum Henriette Polak
Description_Text:
Museum Henriette Polak focuses on artists on the crossroads of tradition and innovation, between the abstract and figurative. A center for modern classic painting and sculpture.

Museum Henriette Polak is the center for modern classic painting and sculpture in the Netherlands. Since its opening in 1975, Museum Henriette Polak has displayed the vitality, variety and vigor of figurative art, created by a combination of skill and inspiration.

Figurative art rooted in academic tradition
The eponymous patron Henriette Polak-Schwartz befriended artist Joop Sjollema in 1964. He convinced her of the necessity for a museum of Dutch figurative art, rooted in academic tradition. This initiative was contrary to the times, as museums mainly focused on abstract and conceptual art.

Oepts, Wolkers and Van Pallandt
Get to know Henriette Polak and discover the collection in this intimate museum. Marvel at masterpieces by Kees Verwey, Charlotte van Pallandt, Wim Oepts, Arie Schippers, Jan Wolkers, Wendelien Schönfeld and others. Discover the many artists’ portraits the museum is known for, and have a look round Het Atelier. Discover a representative selection of the museum collection at the Museum Henriette Polak’s Digital Depot. Create your own exhibition and display the art you’ve chosen on the museum’s walls.
Facilities: Museumwinkel, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's

Name: Museum Het Belfort
Description_Text:
Discover the rich mercantile history of Zeeland in the Netherlands’ only belfry: Museum Het Belfort in Sluis.

Sluis started to develop around the end of the 13th century. Sluis used to be an important port city, especially in the days when it was ruled by the Dukes of Burgundy. In the 17th and 18th centuries, Sluis was one of the Netherlands’ most important fortified cities. Today, it is a popular tourist destination.

An interactive presentation
Upstairs, the history of Sluis is told interactively through films, objects and images. Visit the council hall basement, council chamber and the mayor’s room, climb the tower and get to know the most famous and most consulted inhabitant of Sluis, teacher and archivist Johan Hendrik Van Dale, who produced the authoritative dictionary of the Dutch language.

Name: Museum Het Bolwerk
Description_Text:
How did the inhabitants of Zeelandic Flanders protect themselves against hostile invasions? Find out the answer in Museum Het Bolwerk, which focuses heavily on the defenses of the Staats-Spaanse Linies (Spanish State Lines).

Defenses in the Zeeland landscape
During the Eighty Years’ War, hundreds of forts, dikes and lines were built in Zeelandic Flanders. A large number are still visible in the landscape. Museum Het Bolwerk shows how the inhabitants of the border region defended themselves against enemy attacks over the course of centuries. The focus of the collection is on the State-Spanish Lines, a unique cluster of defenses. These are unique because they comprise a part of the foundational history of the Netherlands and are both visible and tangible in the landscape.

Name: Museum Het Pakhuis
Description_Text:
At Museum Het Pakhuis you can learn local history based on archaeological finds, in a literally hands-on way.

Museum Het Pakhuis is a place where visitors can touch exhibits. Feel, smell, taste, touch and live the past. Here you are encouraged to touch the archaeological finds.

Name: Museum Het Schip
Description_Text:
Museum Het Schip is located in an imaginative public housing complex that is popularly referred to as The Ship. It is one of the best examples of Amsterdam School architecture. The museum exhibits focus on the art and architecture of this movement.

Michel de Klerk
Het Schip is the most well-known work by Amsterdam School architect Michel de Klerk. This architectural style is the main focus of the museum. Within Het Schip, the former post office is an extraordinary space. Where else can you find a vaulted rectangular ceiling above an irregular trapezium-shaped floor? And its color combination, purple-blue with lavender is uncommon to say the least. The complex includes a museum residence furbished and furnished according to the popular style of the 1920s. Take the opportunity to look at the garden full of Amsterdam School street furniture.
Facilities: Restaurant, Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum Het Spinozahuis
Description_Text:
The Spinozahuis Museum is located in the house where the Dutch philosopher Baruch Spinoza lived from 1661 to 1663. He lived in a small room where he ground lenses for optical instruments and wrote down his thoughts with a quill.

The house includes a reconstruction of Spinoza’s library. Against the backdrop of a room with an ambiance as might be depicted in a painting by Vermeer or De Hoogh, this collection of parchments and leatherbound volumes is unique in the world. The museum collection also includes portraits and reproductions of letters and documents. Also on display are old instruments used to grind lenses. We comply with all current corona measures.

Name: Museum Het Warenhuis - Axel
Description_Text:
Discover how the people of the ‘Land van Axel’ region lived in the period between 1850 and 1950 at the local museum Het Warenhuis. The museum’s highlight is a collection of traditional clothing from the region.

Farmer’s room
Part of the rich collection is a modern interpretation of a historic farmer’s room, as well as an iconic arrangement of tools and equipment.

Traditional clothing and jewelry
The museum’s core collection consists of a comprehensive overview of local traditional clothing as well as jewelry. It also includes several carriages, coaches and carts.

Locations
The museum encompasses two national heritage sites containing unique, recently restored paintings on the ceilings, walls and floors. The museum is suitable for young and old alike. Het Warenhuis also includes two external buildings: the Stadsmolen (‘city mill’) dating to 1750 and the Watertoren (water tower), which dates back to 1936. Both are national heritage sites.

Name: Museum Hilversum
Description_Text:
With up to ten exhibitions a year, Hilversum Museum is where the media arts and photography meet. The museum also focuses on new media and crossovers.

Zilveren Camera (Silver Camera)
Hilversum Museum is an inspiring museum in the heart of the city. The museum is also the home of the Canon Zilveren Camera (Canon Silver Camera), the most important photojournalism award in the Netherlands. Aside from three spacious floors of exhibition space, the museum also offers a cozy café and a shop. The museum organizes regular lectures, performances and media labs.

Name: Museum Hindeloopen
Description_Text:
Three centuries ago, Hindeloopen grew into an important trading city. Museum Hindeloopen illustrates the rich history of Hindeloopen, a small city on the edge of the former Zuiderzee.

Upstairs, you’ll find the eye-catching audiovisual room, which is shaped like a large sailing ship, where you can see a short film about a merchant ship’s journey to St. Petersburg. On this floor, you can also find a reconstruction of a typical Hindeloopen home, dating from circa 1740.

Craftsmanship
The museum also focuses on the fishing industry and development of Hindeloopen. Discover the typical folk costume and the world-famous Hindeloopen furniture.

Name: Museum Hoeksche Waard
Description_Text:
At Museum Hoeksche Waard, meet a craftswoman, landowner, village physician, artisan, store employee, farm laborer and schoolchild. Each of them has helped make Hoeksche Waard into what it is today.

Landowners and farmworkers
Museum Hoeksche Waard is housed in two buildings that are national heritage sites: the luxury farmhouse Oost-Leeuwenstein and the stately Hof van Assendelft. Experience how people in the past lived and worked, and learn about the inequalities between landowners and farmworkers and between men and women.

Name: Museum Huis Doorn
Description_Text:
Experience the imperial grandeur of Huis Doorn. Wilhelm II, the last German Emperor, lived at Huis Doorn until his death. The Huis Doorn furnishings were brought in from palaces in Berlin and Potsdam. To this day, the manor looks fit for a monarch.

Imperial living
Huis Doorn is an imperial residence in the middle of a village. Visit the 18 authentically furnished rooms where the last German Emperor lived, and feel like you’re stepping back in time. After Germany’s defeat in World War I, Kaiser Wilhelm II fled to the Netherlands and lived here in exile. The original 14th-century water castle was converted into an elegant manor in the late 18th century. Wilhelm II bought the manor in 1919 and overhauled both it and the 35-hectare park to provide all the comforts he required.

The furnishings at Huis Doorn were brought from the imperial palaces at Berlin and Potsdam. The interior remains unchanged since Kaiser Wilhelm II died in 1941, and presents an authentic view of imperial living.

World War I
Huis Doorn Museum links the personal story of the German Emperor to the history of the destructive First World War and the soldiers that fought in it. The exhibition pavilion on the First World War includes these stories as well as information on the effect of the war on the Netherlands.

Name: Museum In 't Houten Huis
Description_Text:
The Dutch were preeminent whalers in the 17th and early 18th century. Learn all about the whalers and the rich history of the former island of Schermereiland and its seafaring inhabitants at Museum in ’t Houten Huis (Museum in the wooden house).

Shipping and fishing
At the museum, learn all about fishing for haring, whaling and shipping. Marvel at its collection of nautical charts, ship’s logs and prints, and immerse yourself in the maritime world.

Wooden house
Whaling and seafaring were prominent features in the history of De Rijp. Discover the history of its wooden houses, as the museum itself is housed in an 18th-century wooden building.
Facilities: Rolstoeltoegankelijk, Drinken, Parkeergelegenheid voor auto's, Museumwinkel

Name: Museum JAN
Description_Text:
Museum JAN in Amstelveen is the home of visual arts, specializing in glass. The museum’s collection consists of many unique glass items collected by the museum’s founder, Jan van der Togt.

In addition to the main collection, Museum JAN offers a broad and appealing exhibition program on modern and contemporary art and design.

JAN and JAN
